( the order of business be adopt thus amend ) safety adviser for the transport of dangerous good the next item be the report ( A5-0105 / @card@ ) by Mr Koch , on behalf of the Committee on Regional Policy , Transport and Tourism , on the common position adopt by the Council with a view to adopt a European Parliament and Council directive on the harmonisation of examination requirement for safety adviser for the transport of dangerous good by road , rail or inland waterway ( C5-0208 / @card@ - @card@ / @card@ ( Cod ) ) . </s>
Commissioner , Madam President , lady and gentleman , I can be quite frank in say that I welcome the Council 's common position on harmonise the training of safety adviser for the transport of dangerous good by road , rail or inland waterway . </s>
firstly , we need to take action on a formal level in order to meet the requirement of Directive @card@ / @card@ / EC , which oblige the Member States to appoint safety adviser and to organise the training , instruction and examination of these people but do not explain this explicitly . </s>
secondly , by adopt this directive we achieve a ) an increase in safety when dangerous good be both transport and transship ; b ) a reduction in distortion of competition result from wide variation in national training structure and training cost and c ) equal opportunity for safety adviser on the European labour market . </s>
thirdly , this directive , as it currently stand in the common position , guarantee - in particular because it confine itself exclusively to minimum standard - a high degree of flexibility and modest regulation by the European Union ; by adopt it we contribute to the Member States ' bear a high level of individual responsibility . </s>
all of this be in accordance with the principle of subsidiarity and be therefore to be greatly welcome . </s>
our amendment from the first reading have , I believe , be take into account very satisfactorily . </s>
they have either be accept or transpose with no change in the substance , or they have be reject because the corresponding European arrangement have not be include , for example a system of penalty for violation of the rule or a complex classification structure for related group of question . </s>
the one unanimously adopt amendment of the Committee on Regional Policy and Transport , which concern the timetable for implement the directive , be something which I would urge you to support . </s>
by not set a specific date for the Member States to implement the directive and instead give them a period of three month after its entry into force , we be introduce a flexibility clause which ensure that the directive will be implement without delay . </s>
I would urge you to endorse this . </s>
madam President , we can and must not accept the fact that we hear ever more frequently of accident cause major damage on our road , but also on our railway and waterway , not solely but at least partly because those involve do not take the transport of dangerous good seriously enough or because - as a result of ignorance or a lack of training on the part of the driver or other responsible for the various vehicle - a minor accident have all too often become a major disaster . </s>
as an Austrian , I still have a vivid memory , as , I believe , we all do , of the catastrophe which cost so many human life last year in the Tauern Tunnel , where subsequent work to rebuild the part of the tunnel which have be destroy in this fire continue for many month at huge expense . </s>
the renovation project , which last for month , cut off this important route between the north and south of Europe . </s>
the traffic which have to be divert because of this stretch the patience of many thousand of people in the Eu to the limit . </s>
in fact , all hell break loose in some municipality in my province . </s>
prevention have to be our answer to disaster of this kind and this draft directive be an important step towards well-trained safety adviser be available , so that the right action be take in good time . </s>
All the same , we must not content ourselves with enact European law to ensure great safety . </s>
we also need to follow this up and make sure that our rule be transpose by the Member States in good time and - even more importantly - we need to ensure that they be also apply afterwards . </s>
Please let this not be yet another sector where we subsequently have to lament the lack of enforcement . </s>
I should like to address one final point . </s>
we must not content ourselves with seal another hole in the safety net and shut our eye to the fact that , where transport safety in Europe be concern , there be still much more to be do . </s>
in this context , I should like to make a request and ask the Commissioner responsible , who be with us here today , to table an appropriate text as soon as possible with a view to continue to make it safe for traffic to transit tunnel in the future , so that we in Europe do not have to experience any more such disaster on this scale . </s>

Mr President , lady and gentleman , the Commission 's White Paper on modernisation of the European competition rule have ignite intense and lively debate amongst interested member of the public . </s>
the reaction from expert and person affect range from complete rejection to unconditional support . </s>
What be this White Paper , in fact , about ? </s>
the existing system of European competition rule be set up in the early year of the Community . </s>
this system , which be base on a centralise application and approval procedure , be certainly appropriate for the condition prevail at the time . </s>
this procedure make a substantial contribution to the development of a European competition culture . </s>
however , the framework condition have fundamentally change in the @card@ year since it come into be . </s>
the Community of 6 have enlarge to one of @card@ and be set to undergo further enlargement to encompass @card@ member . </s>
but the system have hardly change at all . </s>
that be why there be an urgent need for reform , and no one take issue with this in debate . </s>
nevertheless , certain critic be of the opinion that the Commission 's proposal go too far . </s>
the Commission want to abolish the application and approval procedure and enhance the role of national authority and court in the implementation of the competition rule . </s>
in other word , this would mean a transition from an authorisation system to one of legal exemption . </s>
however , the prohibition principle , and this be important , be to be retain . </s>
in principle , I take the view that we ought , when an authority accuse of tend towards bureaucracy and centralism , submit a proposal for debureaucratisation and decentralisation , to at least give this serious consideration . </s>
accord to the Commission 's proposal , it all revolve around competition-inhibiting agreement between enterprise and abuse of powerful position . </s>
however , the notification obligation , with respect to state aid and corporate concentration , be to be retain . </s>
the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs give its blessing in principle to these proposal put forward by the Commission , with only one vote against and two abstention . </s>
however , it will only be possible to form a conclusive assessment once the currently await bill produce by the Commission be publish . </s>
whilst I may endorse the Commission 's proposal in principle , still there be a number of point that warrant improvement , or at least clarification . </s>
I would like to go into some of these point briefly . </s>
Many critic of the White Paper maintain that decentralisation will jeopardise the consistent application of Community legislation . </s>
not all national authority , in particular the court , be in a position as yet to fulfil the role the Commission have in mind for them when it come to the application of the competition rule . </s>
firstly , in the course of the last few decade the national monopoly have familiarise themselves with the implementation of the competition rule to an adequate degree . </s>
secondly , the national court will be empower to implement Articles @card@ ( 1 ) , @card@ and @card@ in accordance with the current administration of justice . </s>
Nonetheless , it be still extremely important for the Commission to support the national authority and court with group exemption regulation , guideline and notice . </s>
furthermore , cooperation between the national authority and the Commission , as well as amongst the national authority themselves , must be strengthen . </s>
as far as the competence of the national court be concern , we recommend in this report that specialise court be set up for deal with monopoly law proceeding . </s>
these be already in existence in certain Member States and they have prove successful . </s>
entrepreneur , for their part , fear a loss of legal certainty . </s>
in order to guard against this , the enterprise should , in certain case , continue to have the opportunity of be give prior clarification by the Commission . </s>
these be only a few , albeit central aspect that must be take into account where the modernisation of the European competition rule be concern . </s>
that say , the process be still very much in its infancy . </s>
discussion will continue until such time as legislative proposal be eventually produce . </s>
however , I be convince of the fact that the White Paper have put us on the right path . </s>
a European competition culture have come into be in the course of the last few decade . </s>
the decentralisation propose by the Commission accord with the principle of subsidiarity , which have , in fact , now be firmly establish in the Treaty . </s>
this lead to increase implementation of the European competition rule at national and regional level , thereby make it possible for the European competition culture to be place on a broad basis . </s>
finally , I would like to say that the competition policy reform we be introduce here be a necessity and that it be go to be absolutely necessary , in this context , to clarify that the European Union 's competition policy be an essential pre-requisite to the success of a social market economy . </s>
both the Commission and Parliament must do more than they have do hitherto to get the message across that competition policy , competition between enterprise , and the fact that the European Commission be supervise this , be first and foremost matter which have the interest of the citizen at heart . </s>

drop the obligation to notify will mean less red tape and administration cost , at any rate . </s>
at the same time , this change of system will also lead to more onus be place on the individual in the business world , of course . </s>
it will no longer simply be a case of submit paper and have them approve ; for one thing , each person will have to take responsibility themselves , and that be probably why there be unease about this in other quarter . </s>
however I believe that we should use this opportunity for Europe to set down a marker for less red tape . </s>
the second point relate to the retrodisplacement of law enforcement . </s>

efficiency : I be convince that this reform will strengthen the protection of competition within the single market rather than weaken it . </s>

the reform will lead to a gradual development - I stress this because I be particularly take with this term , use by Mrs Randzio-Plath , and , moreover , I fully agree with it - of European competition culture . </s>

more specifically , we intend to establish a system which will allow us to determine the liability of the owner or forward of the cargo and hold them liable - indeed , it be because there be forwarder who show little concern for the quality of the ship they charter that shipowner choose to register their vessel abroad - as well as increase the insurance premium pay by shipowner in respect of the total sum insure per ship . </s>

Mr President , I be very please to take this first available opportunity of outline to Parliament the main line of the Commission 's White Paper on food safety , adopt on Wednesday last , @card@ January , in association with my colleague , Mr Liikanen . </s>
at my hearing last September , I promise speedy delivery of this White Paper . </s>
I be happy that we have be able to deliver so quickly . </s>
the White Paper represent three to four month of intensive work since the new Commission be appoint last September . </s>
it take on board the extensive consultation of the past couple of year since the Commission 's Green Paper on food law be publish . </s>
equally it reflect our experience of recent food alert in such area as dioxin and sludge , as well as the BSE crisis . </s>
the White Paper also reflect the concern of this Parliament which you have outline to both President Prodi and myself on the numerous occasion we have debate food safety in this House since the Commission be appoint . </s>
I do not need to remind you that consumer confidence in Europe 's food safety regime have be badly affect by the crisis and alert of recent year and month . </s>
the Commission be fully commit to restore that confidence by put in place the most up-to-date and effective food safety regime in the world . </s>
when I launch the White Paper last week I say that the shopping trolley be one of the most potent weapon on the face of the earth . </s>
the most discerning decision be make by the consumer of Europe . </s>
if their confidence be damage this be reflect in shopping decision . </s>
this in turn have a dramatic effect on farmer , producer and industry generally . </s>
in an industry worth some EUR @card@ billion annually , even a slight dip in confidence level can have significant effect . </s>
between the agro-food sector and the farm sector there be over @card@ million employee . </s>
high level of confidence be necessary to boost job number and competitiveness . </s>
this crisis of confidence have also have the unfortunate but inevitable effect of erode the trust of consumer in the system and institution at national and European level that should monitor and assure the high standard of food safety . </s>
in say all of this , I would like to make it clear that Europe nevertheless have one of the good food industry in the world and also one of the safe food control system . </s>
the challenge be to make the system the very good . </s>
the overall objective therefore of the White Paper on food safety be to put in place the necessary legislation and structure that will guarantee the high possible level of health protection for consumer arise from the consumption of food . </s>
we be set out a challenging and ambitious agenda for change . </s>
the Commission will need the full support of Parliament if we be to achieve our ambition on schedule . </s>
we will also need the full support from the Council and other key stakeholder . </s>
the White Paper on food safety outline a comprehensive range of action need to complement and modernise existing Eu food legislation . </s>
all of these measure be design to make it more coherent , understandable and flexible . </s>
we want to promote good enforcement of that legislation and to provide great transparency to consumer . </s>
the detailed action plan on food safety in the White Paper set a precise timetable for action over the next three year . </s>
over @card@ measure be envisage . </s>
our objective be to put in place a coherent and up-to-date body of food law by the end of @card@ . </s>
we be also envisage the establishment of a European food authority by @card@ as an essential complement to the new food safety regime . </s>
this idea will be the focus of much scrutiny and debate . </s>
it have already attract much comment , include reaction from member of Parliament . </s>
the chapter of the White Paper devote to the establishment of a European food authority be clearly design to elicit view and comment . </s>
we be seek view by the end of April on what we envisage . </s>
I will return to this process of consultation in a few moment . </s>
the Commission believe that major structural change be require in our system of food safety to ensure the twin objective of assure the high standard of food safety and restore consumer confidence . </s>
why should a European food authority be an essential part of that structure of change ? </s>
the first key concern be independence . </s>
Key stakeholder , include consumer , be seek a system that be independent and perceive to be independent of all vested interest . </s>
we must also ensure excellence and transparency . </s>
we have make a lot of progress over the past couple of year since the reform system of scientific advice be adopt as a consequence of the BSE crisis . </s>
however , the Commission believe that we must go further . </s>
we must create a permanent and truly independent , excellent and transparent system of risk assessment . </s>
the key task of the authority will be risk assessment in the area of food safety . </s>
we envisage that the work of the exist five scientific committee devote to food safety will be transfer to the authority . </s>
they may not be transfer in their present form or structure - this be an issue on which we will elicit view before make our definitive proposal on the authority 's establishment . </s>
however , if we be merely to propose a simple moving of deckchairs , this would clearly not be enough . </s>
as the White Paper make clear , the new authority must be a value-added structure . </s>
I be of the view that the existing system of scientific advice need to be strengthen . </s>
within the authority I envisage much strong scientific and other support for the independent scientist . </s>
I be also envisage that the authority will be much more proactive than our current regime - anticipate rather than react , identify issue before they become crisis . </s>
this proactive approach should become the hallmark of the authority . </s>
To be proactive the White Paper identify a number of new area that would be embrace by the authority . </s>
these include a comprehensive information gathering and surveillance function , the coordination of scientific information in the Eu , and build up strong network with food safety agency and body in Member States . </s>
as part of its remit we also envisage the authority operate an enhanced rapid alert system for food and feed concern . </s>
the Commission have decide that it be neither appropriate nor feasible to devolve risk management power to the authority . </s>
we believe that decision in the risk management area should properly remain the preserve of the Commission , Parliament and Council . </s>
I make no apology for this approach ; I firmly believe that it be the correct one . </s>
certainly there be those who would argue that we should give law-making power to such an authority . </s>
I do not accept those view and reject them with some degree of passion . </s>
it be only last year that the Treaty be amend to give Parliament a much great role in the legislative process . </s>
To give such a role to an authority at this stage would be , in my view , a retrograde step and represent a dilution of democratic accountability . </s>
I will be very interested to hear the view of Parliament itself in relation to this matter . </s>
There be also those who argue that the Commission could effectively ignore the advice of the new authority . </s>
I also reject this line of argument . </s>
How could a Commissioner for Health and Consumer Protection reject or ignore well-founded independent scientific advice in relation to food safety ? </s>
Would this be in the interest of Europe 's citizen ? </s>
in my view , most definitely not unless such rejection of the scientific argument be soundly base , rationally argue and fully justify . </s>
it seem difficult to envisage such a situation evolve . </s>
I can assure you here today that the Commission , in exercise its risk management function , will fully take account of the scientific advice of the authority . </s>
I have already say that the authority will be charge with develop network with national food safety agency and body in the Member States . </s>
this be a major task . </s>
we must develop great certainty in the science that underpin food safety in the European Union . </s>
the authority must become the authoritative source of scientific advice and information on food safety issue . </s>
this situation will not come about by the very creation of the authority but will evolve over time as confidence be gain in the authority itself . </s>
I do not believe we can be prescriptive in the area of science and advice base on science . </s>
however , with the evolution of dynamic network with national scientific body and agency , the authority will become pre-eminent on the European stage . </s>
I be also anxious to hear the view of Parliament in this regard . </s>
as an integral part of a value-added structure , the White Paper propose that the authority would have a major role in risk communication : to disseminate complex scientific information in a consumer-friendly way ; to be the obvious and indispensable port of call for the most up-to-the-minute datum on risk ; to be highly visible ; to tell the good news story about food ; to be proactive . </s>
the White Paper also contain very important proposal in respect of control . </s>
this be a hugely important component of the system of check and balance to ensure that Member States and operator be comply with Community legislation . </s>
I want to see a genuine internal market operate in the control arena . </s>
in this context we be also propose to strengthen significantly the control function carry out by the food and veterinary office locate in Dublin . </s>
this revise Community framework would have three core element : operational criterion set up at Community level , Community control guideline , and enhanced administrative cooperation in the development and operation of control . </s>
as part of our proposal in this area - which I expect to bring forward at the end of this year - I will be examine whether additional power in addition to infringement procedure need to be give to the Commission . </s>
these could include withhold Community financial support or recoup funding already commit to a Member State . </s>
these proposal must be see as part of our mission to have the high food safety standard in the world , boost consumer confidence and increase market for farmer and producer in the Union . </s>
in addition to the proposal for a new European food authority and an enhanced control system at Community-level , the White Paper propose an action plan with a wide range of measure to improve and bring coherence to the Community 's legislation , cover all aspect of food product from farm to table . </s>
it set out over @card@ separate action that be envisage over the period ahead and intend to close identify loophole in current legislation . </s>
the new legal framework will cover animal feed , animal health and welfare , hygiene , contaminant and residue , novel food , additive , flavouring , packaging and irradiation . </s>
it will include a proposal on general food law which will embody the principle of food safety such as responsibility of feed manufacturer , farmer and food operator , traceability of feed , food and ingredient , proper risk analysis through , for instance , risk assessment - that be , scientific advice and information analysis - risk management - that be , regulation and control - risk communication , and application of the precautionary principle if and when appropriate . </s>
as regard the precautionary principle , I might add that the Commission be currently finalise a communication which I expect to be adopt very soon . </s>
I look forward to have a useful exchange of view this afternoon with the member of Parliament who would clearly have preferred to do this last week if there have be an appropriate parliamentary forum available . </s>
however , have regard to my contact with the president of the relevant committee , I recognise that this be not feasible . </s>
but I know too that we will have many further opportunity in the come month to consider the White Paper 's proposal on the authority . </s>
we now have a number of month to have the necessary debate on the Commission 's idea on the White Paper on the establishment of a European food authority . </s>
Parliament will have a key part to play in this debate . </s>
Parliament play a crucial role in Europe 's response to the BSE crisis . </s>
it have especially active since then in bring citizen ' concern about food safety issue to the fore . </s>
I expect that Parliament 's contribution to the debate on the authority can be as incisive and constructive . </s>
while we have a number of month to the end of April to debate the issue and garner our view , I recognise fully that this be also a very tight timeframe . </s>
I would therefore ask Parliament to make appropriate arrangement to ensure that its view can be formulate as quickly as possible . </s>
it be essential that the Commission should have the benefit of Parliament 's contribution to the shape of what would be a key component of raise consumer health protection to a new plane and thereby restore consumer confidence in the European Union 's food safety regime . </s>
the European food authority will be a key ingredient in the Eu 's food safety regime in the year ahead . </s>

the overall aim of the reform must be to create a strong , honest European public administration equip to carry out its task in an effective and efficient manner ; an administration in which official be provide with the mean to carry out their task and be hold fully accountable at all level ; an administration that recognise and reward merit and encourage official to develop their full potential . </s>

madam President , Mr President-in-Office of the Council , Commissioner , during the Asian crisis in @card@ , as with those which hit Mexico in @card@ or the EMS in @card@ , everyone could see the damage cause to the economy of entire country by financial speculation , particularly currency speculation . </s>
between EUR 1 @card@ and 2 @card@ billion be trade every day on the financial market . </s>
in three or four day , this can equal the total figure of annual global production , or global GDP , of approximately EUR 6 @card@ billion . </s>
the bulk of these financial transaction be purely speculative and do not involve any trade in good or investment . </s>
yet the erratic movement of these massive sum of capital can , in a few hour , cause the collapse of a currency or the economy of a country , plunge its whole population into recession . </s>
in view of this situation , renewed interest have be express in the proposal by James Tobin , winner of the Nobel Prize for Economics , to create a tax on currency transaction . </s>
the rate of this would be very low so that it do not affect trade in good or investment , but it would act as a light brake on the wheel of speculation , thereby check the multiplication of short-term transaction . </s>
note that this propose tax , which seem to be produce strong emotion in some people , would be the low tax in the world and the low in the history of global taxation . </s>
yet it would represent the recapture of the area seize from democracy by the financial sphere . </s>
One reason for the acceptance of this proposal , and of the campaign by NGOs such as ATTAC , SOLIDAR or other which have popularise this proposal , be that it would release resource which could be allocate to development programme in the poor country , in area such as education or health . </s>
it could act as a kind of asset redistribution in a world where there be both increase wealth and increase poverty . </s>
Many personality and institution have come out in favour of this tax such as the Brazilian President , Fernando Cardoso , the Finnish government , the Canadian Parliament last March and also Lionel Jospin in @card@ . </s>
this question have be debate in several national parliament of the Eu . </s>
the common response have be that this tax could not be apply solely at national level and that the right platform for tackle this be the European Union . </s>
this be the reason for the oral question to the Council and Commission which we have table with @card@ other member . </s>
I be delight with the compromise motion for a resolution which we have reach with the GUE / NGL , Greens / EFA , ELDR and PSE group . </s>
this motion ask the Commission to present a report to Parliament within six month on the feasibility of this tax . </s>
it also ask for an examination of the pressure and financial sanction which could be apply against country which encourage tax evasion or which maintain tax haven . </s>
One of the most common objection be that such a tax would be too complex , but this could be say of any tax . </s>
if this argument have be accept in the past , then no taxis would ever have be create . </s>
the motion also ask that a position document , draw up by the Commission and Council , should be submit before the next annual meeting of the IMF . </s>
the European Union must take the initiative and must also , as demand in the motion , propose this initiative to the G7 because it be primarily a political question . </s>
if the Union take the initiative , this will have a ratchet effect because this debate be occur all over the world , include in the USA and Japan . </s>
a desire be be express everywhere with increase force that the world should not be rule by trader but by the people , their parliament , their government and their democratic institution . </s>
Europe must play a role in this new international regulation and I be extremely happy that today , with this debate and this motion , this question be now on the agenda of European construction . </s>
madam President , I do not have a great deal to add on this subject . </s>
the Council have not yet discuss the possibility of introduce a tax on movement of capital as Professor Tobin suggest . </s>
this be a creative initiative , which we know have be welcome by different industry across the world and by various side in European politics , but the Commission have not yet put forward any proposal or initiative on this issue . </s>

madam President , the revenue basis of the Tobin tax be say to be make up of very short-term exchange transaction . </s>
such transaction , accord to the argument , bear very little relation to fundamental economic variable . </s>
this have also just be underline by Mr Désir . </s>
therefore , accord to proponent , such as Mr Désir , an internationally apply Tobin tax would , in principle , reduce speculative transaction and , hence , the volatility of exchange rate , which would lead to an improvement in economic prosperity . </s>
take into account the considerable volume of short-term financial stream , even a low nominal Tobin tax would yield respectable sum of tax revenue . </s>
in reality , the motive underlie the increase interest in the Tobin tax and other source of international finance in the mid-nineties be non-economic . </s>
indeed , it be fuel by the potential of this tax to generate income for international , public programme at a time when demand for such fund be rise quickly and funding be increasingly hard to come by . </s>
the Commission recently observe renewed interest in a global tax , such as the Tobin tax , as a means of achieve socially responsible globalisation , so to speak . </s>
Mr Désir too have mention this grow interest on all side . </s>
but if the Tobin tax be to be apply unilaterally in order to prevent attack on a specific currency , then this tax could not be effective and it could harm the internal financial market . </s>
put more strongly , in the long term it be possible that for large number of fund , the Tobin tax will be evade by shift foreign exchange rate transaction to off-shore tax haven . </s>
in that case , the tax could lead to a net loss of total economic prosperity . </s>
so the Tobin tax can only be effective if there be a sufficient number of industrialise country which be prepare to participate . </s>
finally , even if the Tobin tax be design to curb speculation with currency , there be still the risk that even non-speculative stream would be affect , and that be not the intention . </s>
for the reason set out above , I can see a good reason for introduce a European Tobin tax . </s>
at any rate , the Commission be against any attempt to restrict capital movement within the European Union . </s>
in more direct term , to the extent that this measure could be deem an indirect restriction on capital stream , this would contravene the Treaty of Rome . </s>
the correct speculative approach , it seem to me , be to remove the real cause which lead to financial chaos , rather than attempt to suppress its symptom by introduce obstacle to the operation of the market . </s>
madam President , Commissioner , I should like once again to say a few word on the modus operandi and the ideological tactic behind this oral question . </s>
also because I know how many social democrat in this House share our criticism , and not just the economic and financial policy expert . </s>

in my view , and I say this quite clearly , the question be ideologically motivate rather than solution-focused . </s>
I consider this to be the wrong way forward for several reason . </s>
why do we reject the Tobin tax and consider it so questionable ? </s>
first , and the Commissioner have also confirm this , because it place a heavy burden on the capital market . </s>
even a small tax would have serious repercussion on the capital market , because this sort of speculation tax would reduce the profitability of investment considerably . </s>
in addition , this sort of measure would also seriously hamper the development of the financial market and would stand in the way of the principle of the free movement of capital , which be one of the central tenet of the internal market . </s>
secondly , speculative capital be extremely difficult to identify . </s>
thirdly , unless they be introduce in all country at the same time , tax measure be easy to circumvent because there be otherwise too many loophole . </s>
fourthly , technically speak , this measure be highly impracticable and will result in a great deal of bureaucracy and administration and be impossible to control . </s>
the measure which we should be take be part of the resolution before us here today . </s>
we need strong banking supervision . </s>
we need to clarify the liability for transaction . </s>
we need a framework of regulation at international level . </s>
we need to examine national law in order to check that they comply with the rule of the Basle committee and how the dissemination of these rule can be step up . </s>

the capital market do not want uncertainty from us , they want clarity ; which be why we reject point 9 and call for a split vote . </s>
madam President , the debate on a tax on short-term financial action be not a new one . </s>
we have be discuss the Tobin tax proposal for twenty year and yet the question be still topical because we need really concrete and honest answer base on careful study . </s>
we need to know just how desirable and feasible a tax on short-term transaction really be . </s>
this question have now enter a different dimension , a dimension in which USD 1 @card@ billion roam the world twenty-four hour a day look for attractive investment , no more than 3 % of which have anything to do with the real economy . </s>
we be concern about stability on the financial market , not for the sake of the financial market , but because this have to do with own growth , our own investment and our own job in the European Union . </s>
we must ask what instrument we can use in order to create the order here which have be miss in the past . </s>
we have do everything to help liberalise financial transaction , but so far we have have no work set of rule , as we have learn from the bitter lesson of the repercussion of the Asian and Latin American crisis . </s>
it be therefore high time that we think both about supervisory regulation and about transparency on the financial market and their information . </s>
it be important that we know who the actor be and what their credit rating be . </s>
we must also ask if there be not a need for fiscal justice . </s>
at a time when the tax burden on the work factor be increase throughout Europe and internationally , we must consider how we can achieve efficient taxation of investment income and that include the question of how to tax short-term financial transaction . </s>

recourse to the precautionary principle the next item be the Commission statement on recourse to the precautionary principle . </s>
I want to start by say that I be please to be present this communication on the use of the precautionary principle , and it have be write together with David Byrne and Erkki Liikanen . </s>
the precautionary principle be not a new concept . </s>
it have be use by the Community for some time now in a range of policy area , environmental , human , animal and plant health ; and it be explicitly mention in the environmental provision of the EC Treaty since Maastricht . </s>
it also appear in a range of international text , for example , the Rio Declaration and most recently the Bio-Safety Protocol . </s>
the essence of the precautionary principle be clear . </s>
it involve take action in a give policy area when the science be not clear , but where there be reasonable ground for concern that the potential risk be big enough to require action . </s>
however , the use of the precautionary principle have be increasingly in the spotlight in recent year . </s>
event such as the BSE and dioxin crisis have stimulate a grow public debate about the circumstance in which precautionary action be justified and necessary . </s>
in view of this grow interest , the Commission therefore consider that it would be useful to present a communication to set out its position on the use of the precautionary principle . </s>
the basic aim of the communication be twofold . </s>
To explain in a clear and coherent way how the Commission apply , and intend to apply , the precautionary principle in its management of risk and to set out guideline for its application base on reason and coherent principle . </s>
we also hope that the communication will help to build a well common understanding of how to manage risk and to dispel fear that the precautionary principle might be use in an arbitrary way or as a disguised form of trade protectionism . </s>
the Commission 's start point in apply the precautionary principle be the need to ensure a high level of protection in the field of environmental , human , animal and plant health . </s>
of course , this objective can be use to justify irrational or arbitrary measure , but it do mean that action can still be take even in situation where the science be unclear . </s>
as such , while the precautionary principle do not involve the politicisation of science , as some have allege , it do take us to the crossroad between science and politics . </s>
the initial decision to apply the precautionary principle depend largely on the level of protection seek and the level of risk that decision-maker be prepare to accept for society . </s>
it be therefore political by nature . </s>
however , the measure that may subsequently be take must obviously comply with the general principle applicable to risk management and the guideline for apply the precautionary principle be therefore the key element of the paper . </s>
measure take must be proportional to the choose level of protection - that be , we do not use the sledgehammer to crack a nut . </s>
they must be non-discriminatory in their application , that be measure should not differentiate on the basis of geographical origin . </s>
and they must be consistent with similar measure already take . </s>
for example , if one product have be approve , similar product should also be approve . </s>
measure be base on an examination of the potential benefit and cost of action or lack of action ; that be , the measure should be cost-effective and subject to review in the light of new scientific datum and be clear about who be responsible for produce the scientific evidence necessary for a more comprehensive risk assessment , that be the burden of proof . </s>
All these element have to apply cumulatively . </s>
it be also important to bear in mind that there be a wide range of measure , which can be take in apply the precautionary principle . </s>
for example , a research programme , public information campaign , recommendation and so on . </s>
apply the precautionary principle do not , therefore , automatically imply a ban . </s>
this communication do not pretend to be the final word on this issue ; however , it be the first time that the Commission have present a structured presentation of the principle and its operational use . </s>
by set out in some detail how the Commission apply , and intend to apply , the precautionary principle , we hope to be able to clarify the situation at Community level and to contribute to the ongoing debate at European and international level . </s>

the truth be that these fundamental reason for a thorough reform of the entire Community judicial system also explain the possible reform of the Court of First Instance which we be discuss today , although that have a different legal basis , namely the Treaty of Amsterdam . </s>
these reason do , however , justify such a reform , particularly two or three of them , which I shall now mention . </s>
the first be the imbalance between the increase volume of case , the technical and human capacity of the court in Luxembourg and the strict obligation to adhere to multilingual proceeding , which be the natural consequence of respect for each country 's language and legal tradition . </s>
the last reason be that this court , the Court of First Instance , be the only instance to which individual and company have recourse on economic dispute with regard to decision by the body which affect them . </s>
therefore , the propose increase to @card@ judge be fully justify because , ultimately , it be a matter of increase the Court 's efficiency and it will enable two additional chamber to be establish , in each of which three judge will sit . </s>
the second reform propose concern an increase in the jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance , which , at present , only cover action for annulment by private individual but which will then also cover action bring by Member States . </s>
I be talk here about potential action by the Member States concern transport policy , competition rule applicable to undertaking , state aid , trade protection measure , the application of fund , and other action programme under which the Community grant financial assistance , particularly concern proceeding relate to fraud against the Community budget . </s>
when Member States accept the possibility of an appeal to the Court of First Instance involve proceeding on the same matter as an action already bring by a private individual , the Court will be able to establish what appeal a Member State have lodge . </s>
this will put Member States and private individual on an equal footing in the way the Court function . </s>
Mr President , some people will call this a lightweight reform , but the fact be that it be an achievable reform , base on standard which make it permissible under the Treaty of Amsterdam . </s>
it be basically the reform envisage and request by the Court of the European community itself independently of the IGC and on the basis of the Treaty currently in force . </s>
I believe , particularly because there be such considerable consensus within the committee , that Parliament will agree to these two proposal and that it will give the Court its vote . </s>
we can only hope that the Council will do the same . </s>
my last hope be that the Court will make the well possible use of its new power , the new jurisdiction which this Parliament have , not a moment too soon , decide to grant it . </s>

culture @card@ the next item be the report ( A5-0009 / @card@ ) by Mr Graça Moura , on behalf of the European Parliament delegation to the Conciliation Committee , on the joint text approve by the Conciliation Committee for a European Parliament and Council decision establish a single financing and programming instrument for cultural cooperation ( ' Culture @card@ ' ) ( C5-0327 / @card@ - @card@ / @card@ ( Cod ) ) . </s>
madam President , in spite of Article @card@ of the Treaty of Amsterdam , culture have be the poor relative in term of the reduce range of programme and financial , technical and human resource find for the European project . </s>
some may say that the prevail objective fifty year ago when the &quot; European home &quot; in which we now live be found be more specifically economic and social one . </s>
it may also be say that European policy have suffer , throughout these five decade , from the innumerable and crazy whim that have hold sway in a wide variety of situation and for a wide variety of reason . </s>
however , in the spirit of Europe 's founding father , we must inevitably bear in mind the model for civilisation which lead them to seek to establish lasting condition for peace . </s>
this model for civilisation be root in deep cultural diversity . </s>
a Europe of national identity can live for a long time in peace and prosperity if this cultural diversity maintain its vitality and eliminate the small-mindedness and aggressiveness cause by resentment which , as a rule , give rise to excessively nationalistic feeling . </s>
if this cultural diversity be to succeed , it be vital that there should be mutual understanding and a sharing of the value of civic humanism , tolerance , knowledge and artistic and other form of cultural expression which have take root in Europe 's fertile soil , and which reflect the most noble and profound aspect of the human spirit . </s>
therefore , for this understanding and share to be fully possible , they must be base on a concept of culture which involve the crucial dimension of European democracy . </s>
There be no doubt that genuine convergence , economic and social cohesion , the single currency , the fight against unemployment and social exclusion and even competition be all necessary to create condition which can provide great equality , great development , a good quality of life , and good opportunity for the people of Europe . </s>
There be no doubt that the common security and defence policy could strengthen Europe 's identity and status on the world scene . </s>

secondly , we want to establish the fact that the manufacturer be liable . </s>

No . </s>

nor have certain amendment , which take together would make the text more consistent and meaningful . </s>

on the other hand , it take the liberty of agree , and even congratulate itself in paragraph 4 , on the political intent of the statement by the Portuguese Presidency . </s>

this be how we view the matter and this be the third reason for our vote , because the result of the free and democratic exercise of the Austrian people 's right to vote be not be consider or respect . </s>
at least they should not be prejudge , which be what be happen here . </s>

( FR ) Madam President , lady and gentleman , commissioner and member of the Committee on Regional Policy , Transport and Tourism , I be give the task of draw up the European Parliament 's report on the Community Initiative Programme INTERREG III . </s>
upon referral to committee , we examine over a hundred amendment and , so far , @card@ amendment , some of which have already be present in committee , have once again be table . </s>
before discuss the content of the resolution , I should like to inform you of the element which I take account of and which guide my work as rapporteur . </s>
first of all , I would like to remind you of the function of the INTERREG Community initiative , found on the principle of transnationality and innovation . </s>
this programme constitute a drive force for development on the European scale . </s>
INTERREG be one of the four Community initiative schedule for the period @card@ , and be the one with the large budget for implementation , I. E. EUR @card@ billion as oppose to EUR @card@ billion at the present time . </s>
the INTERREG initiative , create in @card@ , be build upon the wish to make the region of Europe ready for a ' Europe without frontier ' in the context of establish the great single market . </s>
at the time of the reform of the structural fund in @card@ and @card@ , the INTERREG CIP have incorporate new strand contribute to the development of trans-European transport and energy distribution network . </s>
these programme promote cross-border , transnational and interregional cooperation within the European Union by encourage balanced development of the Community area . </s>
the INTERREG III programme , for which we have before us today the guideline issue by the European Commission , pursuant to the term of European Community Regulation no @card@ de @card@ lay down general provision on the Structural Funds , continue these measure . </s>
it be base on three strand . </s>
strand a organise cross-border cooperation between regional and local authority in border region , at both internal and external border of the European Union , on the basis of joint cross-border development strategy which Member States ' local and regional authority be responsible for implement . </s>
strand B govern transnational cooperation between national , regional and local authority in various Member States or applicant country regard regional development , transport network and the environment . </s>
member state , i. e. national authority , be responsible for implement this strand . </s>
finally , strand C organise interregional cooperation between different region of the Member States or third country to exchange experience under strand A and B and cooperate in the field of research and technological development , subject to consultation with the European Commission which be responsible for its implementation . </s>
the new INTERREG programme , in the form in which we have receive it , take into consideration the need engender by enlargement to the country of Eastern and Central Europe and to island region and most remote region . </s>
the Commission propose redistribute the INTERREG funding as follow : between @card@ and @card@ % for strand A , 6 % for strand C , and the remainder for strand B , i. e. from @card@ up to a maximum of @card@ % . </s>
the European Commission draw up the list of eligible region for strand a and strand B. it base its assessment principally on the map of region eligible during the previous programming period . </s>
the most remote region may benefit from support under strand B. The Commission draw up a list of priority area and eligible measure which for strand a be not comprehensive , but be comprehensive for strand B. The Commission reserve the option to , at a late date , put forward topic it consider important to the exchange of experience and strengthened cooperation between region , for strand C. the adoption procedure for the programme be establish by the general regulation on structural fund . </s>
proposal be draw up by Member States and be submit for approval to the European Commission , which check their conformity with the general guideline , adopt . </s>
these proposal must include a number of element , an overview of the cross-border or transnational priority and strategy , a description of the measure necessary to their implementation and an indicative financial plan . </s>
I belong to the great majority of member of Parliament who vote in favour of continue the INTERREG Community Initiative Programme . </s>
I regret that Parliament be not inform about the appraisal of the previous programme , which would have enable the new measure implement to reach optimum efficiency , but I acknowledge that this be not an easy operation . </s>
I also regret the fact that we have an extremely short period to work in , as the text be examine in parliamentary committee on @card@ November last year and then on @card@ January . </s>

this be not the first time this have happen : Europe be once confront with a similar transformation , an explosion of its market , a change in its point of reference and a different view of the world . </s>
I be refer to the sixteenth century when the discovery of America turn everything upside down . </s>
some country - such as France and Spain - manage to meet the challenge , give rise to great nation state ; other country - such as Italy - do not meet this challenge and lose all the headway that they have accumulate during the first part of that millennium : headway in science , technology , economic progress , defence structure and military organisation , philosophy and literature . </s>
today , Europe be face a similar challenge , and we know that , just as history have be unforgive in the past , it will not be forgive in the present . </s>
in this context of wholesale change , and in order to prevent our nation States vanish again , in the wake of globalisation which be create hitherto unprecedented scale and challenge , Europe need to be economically strong , because globalisation demand unity , because every day we hear news of new agreement at world level and news of change at European level too . </s>
but more vital still be a Europe that feel strong in the political arena . </s>
in year past , the single market and the single currency have be the pivotal point of our action , the mainstay of European life . </s>
today , the new frontier of European integration be political frontier : common foreign and security policy , justice and internal security , and - to a lesser extent - the crucial question of the fundamental political value on which our coexistence be base . </s>
the Commission have therefore adopt the strategic programme for @card@ , a programme that be immediately send to the European Parliament and with which you be already familiar , so I will not go into detail about it now . </s>
some of you may find it lack detail , but no political structure set out detailed five-year programme . </s>
this be the European Union , not the Soviet Union . </s>
our programme highlight the major point of reference , the major area for action : firstly , the development of new form of governance for Europe ; secondly , extension and enlargement of the area of peace , freedom , and security ; thirdly , the launch of a new stage in the growth of the economy ; fourthly , safeguard and improve quality of life . </s>
these will be our major guideline for action over the next five year . </s>

this be an effective , transparent way to proceed and involve all the European institution and the citizen of Europe . </s>
this White Paper be a response to the challenge that enlargement be force on us , an enlargement that be force us to rethink the working of all our institution , rethink our very policy - all our policy - and above all rethink what we must continue to do at Union level when the Member States number @card@ or @card@ , and what will be the good thing to do at individual State level , at regional level and at local government level . </s>
but it be not only enlargement that be urge us towards this rethink : as I say a few moment ago , it be also economic and political globalisation itself . </s>
we must govern Europe in such a way as to make us more efficient , to bring us close to the citizen and to encourage everyone to get involve , start with the important issue of the involvement of woman . </s>

this be a field where Europe have , nevertheless , always be in the vanguard . </s>
we therefore need to reflect on this at length and with an open mind , and all the institution - Commission , Parliament , Council - will have to consider their own role and their own policy . </s>
we shall therefore get straight back to work on this White Paper , although in order to finish it , we shall have to wait for the result of the Intergovernmental Conference , and it will therefore not be ready until spring @card@ . </s>
it will not be a philosophical paper , but a practical paper , full of focused proposal . </s>
we - the Commission - be the first to know that we must have a total rethink , and we shall therefore do two thing : we be , and will continue to be , fully commit to internal reform , and we shall rethink our policy in detail . </s>
I have ask all the commissioner - and I shall ask them once again in a still more analytical way - to pinpoint all the activity that we can forgo . </s>
the Commission must define what its fundamental activity be , what it must concentrate on and shed its non-essential activity , thereby free up new resource and ensure a more correct and co-operative relationship with individual country , region and local community . </s>
so we shall be free up new resource , but - I fear , and I want to state this before Parliament - the time will come when these new resource that we be already free up will , in turn , be insufficient in term of allow us to address our new task : I be think of enlargement , the new sector of justice and home affair , health issue and environmental matter . </s>

as for internal reform , you well know how committed my Commission have be to this since day one . </s>

nevertheless , we definitely have to do more . </s>
we must liberalise trade within the region and between the region and the European Union ; we must contribute to build infrastructural link that will end its centuries-old isolation ; we must intensify effort to build a democratic , pluralist society in these country with institution , public structure , police force and a structured civil society , but , above all , we must press these country to work together in the context of a unite region , as regard both politics and the economy . </s>
if we do not do this , we shall have fail in our duty . </s>

this be what we need to do for the Balkans . </s>

Mr President , Commissioner , do regulate additive in feedingstuffs come under competition or consumer policy ? </s>
as far the Commission and the Legal Affairs Committee be concern , it come under competition . </s>
of course we have to take account of the competitiveness of the feedingstuffs industry by harmonise provision for substance authorise before and after @card@ . </s>
we want to prevent the price of feedingstuffs from rise and Mr Doyle 's propose Amendments Nos 4 and 5 therefore deserve our support . </s>
however , as Mr Graefe zu Baringdorf have say in his report , this be first and foremost a consumer policy matter . </s>
food safety must take absolute priority over feedingstuffs in all our discussion . </s>
when we talk of transparency in the food chain , that apply from the hayfork to the table fork and consumer protection therefore logically start with feedingstuffs . </s>
the antibiotic , growth promoter and genetically-modified organism mix in with feedingstuffs end up in the human food chain . </s>
the dioxin scandal bring home to us that we have to get out of this mess once and for all and regulate additive in feedingstuffs be a step in the right direction . </s>
accord to Article @card@ of the EC Treaty , we be oblige to obviate source of danger to human health , whereby the accent be clearly on source . </s>
consequently , we must cut off the supply of the original source of danger , i. e. harmful additive in feedingstuffs . </s>
otherwise , in my view , we be beaver away at the symptom , but not the cause . </s>
people be especially wary of GMOs . </s>
we must confront increase public awareness of GMOs by regulate their use in feedingstuffs accordingly . </s>
first , if an additive consist of or contain genetically-modified organism , then it should only be authorise if it pose no risk to human health or the environment . </s>
secondly , it make sense to issue provision for genetically-modified feedingstuff additive similar to the regulation in seed marketing legislation , as the rapporteur have say . </s>
and thirdly , if we be to have a transparent consumer policy , we need to label genetically-modified feedingstuffs . </s>
a clear declaration on feedingstuffs will allow double freedom of choice , both for the party use the feedingstuff and the subsequent consumer . </s>
responsible citizen should , in my view , have a choice . </s>
we all talk of scandalise citizen who have lose confidence in food safety . </s>
by regulate additive in feedingstuffs consistently , we can help significantly to restore confidence . </s>
I too , therefore , can hardly wait to hear what you have to say to our propose amendment . </s>
consequently , we too shall also vote to reserve our right to refer the proposal back to committee if need be . </s>

question no @card@ by ( H-0036 / @card@ ) : subject : draft of Charter of Fundamental Rights the general public welcome the fact that a Charter of Fundamental Rights be to be draw up . </s>

? </s>
) Will it set out established social right in the European Union or will it set a broad agenda ? </s>

like the honourable Member , the Commission welcome the decision take by the Heads of State and Government to start the process of draw up a European Charter of Fundamental Rights . </s>
in the conclusion of the Cologne European Council the Heads of State and Government even establish the broad outline of the Charter 's content . </s>
accord to these conclusion , the Charter must contain three category of right . </s>
the first category be right of freedom and equality and procedural right , as guarantee by the European convention for the Protection of Human Rights and fundamental freedom . </s>
the second be the right reserve for citizen of the European Union . </s>
the third be economic and social right , as contain in the European Social Charter and the Community Charter of the Fundamental Social Rights of Workers , insofar as they do not merely establish objective for action by the Union . </s>
the Commission consider that the convention responsible for draw up the Charter of Fundamental Rights must respect the mandate give by the Cologne European Council . </s>
have say that , this do not mean that the convention should be limit to a codify role of simply compile the exist right from various source . </s>
as I have say before in this House , the Commission be convince that the convention must be able , if necessary , to adapt and develop these right in view of current circumstance , particularly technological and social change . </s>
however , give the mandate and the final objective of the text to be submit to the Heads of State and Government , this power must be exercise with caution and on a case-by-case basis . </s>
the right confer by this Charter will have at least two type of beneficiary . </s>
some right will apply to anyone present in the Eu territory while other will benefit only citizen of the European Union . </s>
it may also be envisage that some economic and social right could be guarantee only for citizen of the European Union and third-country national meet certain condition . </s>
it be not possible at this initial stage of the process of draw up the Charter to prejudge its content in more detail . </s>
however , I can confirm that the principle of equal opportunity and equal treatment between man and woman will certainly be include among the right guarantee by the future European Charter of Fundamental Rights . </s>
this be because this principle already figure among the right guarantee by the EC Treaty and by secondary legislation and because it undoubtedly constitute a common constitutional tradition in the Member States . </s>
as I have also say before to this House , the Commission be favourable to insert the Charter in the Eu Treaty . </s>
however , we be fully aware that the final decision on this matter will fall to the Heads of State and Government . </s>
the difficult part , which will fall to the convention , be therefore to draw up an ambitious and politically significant text which can be integrate as such into the treaty . </s>
in its opinion on the holding of an Intergovernmental Conference to amend the treaty , the Commission note that the European Council must decide during the year @card@ on the inclusion of certain item on the IGC agenda , in particular the European Charter of Fundamental Rights . </s>
commissioner , it be quite significant that at the beginning of this new century people in Europe , man and woman , be be call upon to redefine their right and obligation . </s>
we hope that this important Cologne Council decision will become a reality . </s>

Mr President , the situation regard fresh water in Europe be not as serious as in other part of the world but , in general term , it be a fact that the demand for water have continue to grow and its quality have continue to decrease . </s>
To this we must add the water pollution problem which afflict the potential new Member States in the East . </s>
in fact , a reservoir contain cyanide have just burst its bank in Romania , threaten aquifer which supply the population of Yugoslavia . </s>
I understand that Mrs Wallström , whose presence here tonight I appreciate , be go to visit the area . </s>
I believe that no country , no government and , of course , no member of this Parliament can fail to recognise the need for this directive in order to end the current fragmentation of water policy and facilitate the implementation of a programme of specific measure for each river basin . </s>
the development of this directive have be difficult and complex , involve diverse interest and divide opinion . </s>
I have no doubt that the rapporteur for this legislature , Mrs Lienemann , have make great effort and show great dedication in reconcile position , and have succeed to a large extent . </s>
however , it be almost impossible to understand and correctly assess all the different situation and expectation . </s>
I come from a country whose southern half be on the Mediterranean and the availability of water historically depend on the whim of an unpredictable climate and a difficult terrain . </s>
the Mediterranean region have have to fight for its development by try to overcome this adversity , century after century , year after year , day after day , and be still do so today . </s>
therefore , it seem essential to us that the directive comply , in practice , with the obligation lay down in article @card@ of the Treaty on the need for Community legislation to take account of the diversity of its region . </s>
in accordance with this principle , the Spanish delegation of the European People 's Party will oppose Amendments Nos 4 ( Recital @card@ ) , @card@ and @card@ ( Article @card@ ( d ) ) , since they imply a serious limitation in an area of management exclusive to the Member States , that be , the regulation of water resource . </s>
it would be very difficult for the Community to determine the condition for the regulation of water in the different region , give the different internal balance which be always in play and which require profound knowledge of the different area and the relevant interest . </s>
we also reject the amendment which aim to incorporate the integral cost of water for @card@ . </s>
we must clearly set water price which promote its efficient use but which , at the same time , safeguard the competitivity of the produce industry in the less-favoured region and do not hinder their legitimate development . </s>
I would lastly like to refer to the amendment on dangerous substance which establish that we must achieve a zero , or close to zero , degree of pollution . </s>
in no field of human activity have we ever discover a zero degree of pollution . </s>
we will be do a general disservice to the objective of this important directive if we be not able to provide it with the necessary flexibility and adaptability to guarantee compliance with its provision . </s>
I hope that , once again , this House will vote with a sense of reality and respect for the principle of subsidiarity , seek a suitable balance between the environmental objective and economic and social consideration , the three essential element in achieve the sustainable development which we all wish to see so much . </s>
Mr President , Commissioner , this be a very important directive . </s>

budgetary and exchange rate policy be responsible for maintain internal and external stability . </s>
with the Maastricht Treaty and the single currency , budgetary discipline become tight and recourse to devaluation cease as a means of endeavour to restore marginal competitiveness . </s>
the structural and economic difference of the various country can , therefore , be rebalance through budget deficit and trade . </s>
that be the case , in the absence of complete labour mobility inside the Union , and without a redistributive fiscal policy at federal level , it be leave to the labour market and welfare system to provide what degree of flexibility there be to remedy both structural and economic disequilibria , the so-called exogenous asymmetric shock . </s>
and therein lie the paradox . </s>
political and monetary convergence in Europe unavoidably entail convergence of the respective rule of the game in the labour market and welfare system . </s>
but , at the same time , the single currency and the absence of labour mobility , as well as of a redistributive fiscal policy , force us into a situation of non-convergence in term of salary and welfare , in order to compensate for the difference in marginal productivity at national and regional level . </s>
hypocrisy and fine-sounding word such as convergence , benchmarking , modernisation and concerted action be not go to extricate us from those contradiction . </s>
either the European Union become a genuine federal state with a genuine redistribution of resource , genuine free movement of worker and therefore - but only at that point - common labour and welfare regime , or it would be well not to deceive and be deceive by hopeless path to convergence which sound impressive but which , in reality , only cause harm , above all to the most vulnerable . </s>
that be something we would do well to recognise . </s>
