coherence of Eu policy with development the next item be the statement by the Council and the Commission on the coherence of Eu policy with development . </s>
Mr President , it be a great pleasure for me to address you for the first time on behalf of the Council presidency , particularly in view of the very important role that the European Parliament be bind to play in the near future , give the need to strengthen development policy at European Union level . </s>
the subject of the statement that I have the honour of present to you today , be the coherence of different Union policy with development policy . </s>
I shall , of course , give the Commission an opportunity to add to some of the observation that I shall be make . </s>
I would like to start by emphasise the need we all feel , at Eu level , to reconcile the extraordinary development and progress that we have see in many area of life - not least because of the marked technological impetus over recent year , which have benefit people in all walk of life , throughout the world , in term of well-being and improvement in live condition - with the fact that , at the same time , there have be a substantial increase in the pronounced imbalance between some region and geopolitical area of the world . </s>
this endanger the stability of the international system and jeopardise peace . </s>
we be all therefore duty-bound to seek to match our policy good to this objective of achieve great stability and great balance in the various part of our planet . </s>
the consequence of all this be a reassessment of development policy in response to the globalisation of economic and financial market . </s>
a serious imbalance in the functioning of these market have emerge , which have of course make it necessary to make important adjustment , which in turn inevitably mean new option as regard development policy . </s>
we will therefore find ourselves on the threshold of a new model for development policy which - and I would like to stress this - will require action on our part in four essential area : firstly , there will be a need for more concerted action between all international player , by which I mean donor , require great coordination , great coherence and improve link between humanitarian aid and development policy ; it will also require strengthen of the multilateral system and great attention be pay to indebtedness and to financing and development problem . </s>
at the same time , however , there will have to be some change in the framework within which those country now receive aid operate , particularly the need to fight corruption and to maintain democracy and good governance as fundamental principle in develop their political system , together with a need to focus special attention on these country ' own policy for reduce poverty . </s>
the second aspect of this new model for development policy relate to the need for a more integrated approach to development . </s>
this mean not just an approach limit to development aid as the sole element of this policy , but a policy that also increasingly take account of the role of other policy in the sphere of finance , trade and investment . </s>
furthermore , this new model must respect the need for this integrated vision of development to be approach both from a global policy angle and also in the light of the various donor country ' own policy . </s>
a third aspect of this new model that I would like to emphasise be a policy aim at achieve our objective . </s>
since @card@ , follow a concerted international effort between the main donor state , involve in particular a reflection paper produce by the OECD 's Development Assistance Committee , it have be possible to establish some important objective by way of guideline for development policy , both at national and international level . </s>
as you will know , the aim of these objective be to cut poverty by @card@ % by @card@ , by increase compulsory schooling , by significantly reduce child mortality rate , and by implement a raft of social welfare measure with a view to effectively achieve this objective . </s>
this would mean move away from the situation of extreme poverty in which more than a third of the world 's population life , and move away from the extremely poor living condition suffer by over a billion people . </s>
this be an extraordinary state of affair , which certainly mean that if this objective be to be achieve the international community as a whole will have to participate and intervene actively . </s>
and that bring me to the fourth aspect of this new development model that I would like to emphasise . </s>
particularly in recent year , development policy have be regard as an increasingly global matter , and yet there be apparently a lack of strong international leadership . </s>
the concerted action of the United Nations institution have play an important role here , as have the Bretton Woods system . </s>
I have in mind , in particular , the important impetus give to this debate by the World Bank , especially through its Comprehensive Framework document , and by the International Monetary Fund , where , for the first time , an institution of this kind have put the problem of reduce poverty at the centre of its policy guideline and have forge a hitherto unimaginable link , for a body of this type , between debt relief and poverty . </s>
this new role for international organisation on development issue be also a good reason for us to consider the role of the European union in this context . </s>
the Portuguese Presidency have highlight the need for the European Union to combine its highly important international role as the main donor with a lead role - and a more active one - in this movement to reform international development policy , and to create great scope for coordination , in particular with the United Nations system and the Bretton Woods system . </s>
if we be to strengthen the European Union 's role in international development policy , we believe that it be basically necessary to take three kind of action . </s>
firstly , we need to make the Eu 's development policy more effective . </s>
as you know , an exercise be carry out in @card@ involve an overall assessment of development policy , and the result of this overall assessment exercise be present during the German Presidency . </s>
the main conclusion emphasise the need for a more coherent Eu policy and a more strategic overall Eu approach to development issue . </s>
the key aspect be the need for great coordination and great complementarity between policy , the need for harmonisation and simplification of the present organisational framework for the Union 's present cooperation policy , the need to make the Eu 's aid management more efficient and , in particular , to review its mechanism for intervention , and also the need to reinforce the assessment system and to introduce great transparency into the process for grant aid . </s>
a second aspect worth highlight underscore the need for Eu policy and the policy of the Member States to complement each other more . </s>
it be widely know that a significant proportion of aid be today grant under the Member States ' national policy , which be not always complementary or well coordinate . </s>
a great deal of the waste and inefficiency associate with aid from the European Union and its Member States be the result of precisely this lack of coordination and complementarity between the action of individual Member States and the proposal and action of the European institution . </s>
in this respect it be also absolutely vital that we should do our utmost , as soon as possible , to create strong mechanism for ensure that the policy adopt by the Member States and European Union policy be coordinate and complementary . </s>
the third aspect I would like to highlight be the strengthening and coherence of Eu policy , the central theme of today 's debate . </s>
firstly , we be all aware that it be not enough just to improve aid condition and that there be a need for good coordination with other European Union policy , so that development objective can be achieve , not merely through aid and support , but also , first and foremost , through a more integrated approach to the various different policy that contribute to the objective of development . </s>
as you know , a Council Resolution be approve , in June @card@ , under which the Commission be require to present evaluation report . </s>
the first such report be present to the Council in May @card@ , and it refer to certain aspect of policy coordination , notably in the field of peace building , food safety , fishery and migration . </s>
but as you will also be aware , we be wait for a Commission communication on coherence , together with the communication on development policy . </s>
over the come month , that be to say during the Portuguese Presidency , this debate will of course be enrich by the contribution that the Commission have undertake to present to us . </s>
it be evident that the scope for achieve coherence between policy will always be limit and it be only natural for there to be some contradiction between policy as these be mean of balancing and weighting the contradictory and conflicting interest within the European Union . </s>
only in this way be it possible to manage some degree of contradiction between policy . </s>
but , quite apart from this , we would like to emphasise that , if we be to strengthen the coherence of European Union policy in the present circumstance and in the economic situation currently face the Union , we need to give serious consideration to various issue associate with the dynamics of the European Union itself . </s>
by this I mean , of course , the internal dynamics of the European Union . </s>
we know that the European Union have its own dynamics , which stem above all from the Treaty of Amsterdam , which have reinforce its political dimension . </s>
this inevitably have important consequence for the proposal for coherence in policy relate to development . </s>
we will also have to await the outcome of the work of the Intergovernmental Conference as regard enlargement , to see to what extent the internal dynamics of the European Union be direct towards increase the coherence of its policy , and , as regard development in particular , to what extent it also contribute to appropriate institutional arrangement for achieve this objective . </s>
the second aspect that we need to consider , in relation to the coherence of policy , be development policy in the context of the Union 's foreign policy . </s>
we know that the Union have enter a new era as regard its foreign policy , and we know that , with the creation of the High Representative , of the Rapid Reaction Force and of the military crisis management capacity , there be a whole trend towards confirm the status of the European Union that we should not underestimate when we consider the role of development policy . </s>
we also know that there be issue associate with political dialogue , with the adoption of common position or joint action , with the preparation of joint strategy , with preventive diplomacy , and with the development of regional capacity for crisis prevention and management . </s>
There can be no doubt that implement and develop all these aspect will inevitably make an important contribution to strengthen the role of development policy in the context of the European Union 's foreign policy . </s>
it have to be say that , in approach development policy in the context of foreign policy , the European Union be bind to go down the same road as many Member States have do with their own development policy in the context of their individual foreign policy . </s>
the success of this be bind to involve a need to strengthen decision-making mechanism and institutional structure relate to the common foreign and security policy , so as to secure good coordination between instrument of development policy and instrument of foreign policy . </s>
in this context , we be convince that we need to move away from the post ­ colonial model towards to a truly European model of development aid . </s>
I say this because we know that , in Europe , development policy have be very much shape by the policy of certain Member States , in view of the post-colonial concern of those state . </s>
the third aspect that need to be consider be European Union policy and Member States ' policy . </s>
coherence of policy at European level certainly mean good coordination of Member States ' policy with the European Union 's development policy . </s>
if we do not establish improve mechanism to ensure coherence between national policy , it will certainly be more difficult to deliberate against a background of great coherence in European Union development policy . </s>
lady and gentleman , the fourth and final aspect that I would like to draw to your attention , regard development policy , be , of course , the Development Council . </s>
There have be discussion , especially in recent month , about the role the Development Council could play in relation to Eu policy . </s>
as you know , there be a glaring difference between the status of development policy and other Eu policy - you only have to look at the difficult circumstance surround the EDF 's financing , or rather lack of financing . </s>
it be difficult to imagine achieve great coherence in the European Union 's policy without the Development Council play a more active and interventionist role in relation to political decision , which clearly come under the development banner and which be be deal with in other council , in other decision-making forum , range from the Agriculture and Fisheries Councils to the Environment Council . </s>
up to now , the Development Council have not have any opportunity to make its voice hear or to intervene in relation to these decision . </s>
so without a more active role for the Development Council in the overall coordination of political decision making which , although it directly impact on the European Union 's development policy , be largely be deal with outside this decision-making forum , it will certainly be difficult to establish a more coherent European Union policy on development objective . </s>
the view of the European Parliament on this issue too , will certainly be both timely and welcome . </s>

let me start by say something about the successfully conclude negotiation between the Eu and ACP country . </s>
I would like to remark that it be a very positive experience take part in those negotiation . </s>
I see Member States work as a team , which be indeed a wonderful experience . </s>
There be also deep satisfaction on both side when this be over , not just because it be over , but because we all know that we have achieve something together , the Eu and the @card@ ACP country . </s>
that be something that the world need and be a very good signal in the framework of the whole discussion of globalisation . </s>
I shall outline some of the major innovation in the new agreement . </s>
we explicitly address corruption ; we establish a framework for deal with the problem of immigration for the first time ever . </s>
we promote participatory approach , we ensure the consultation of civil society on the reform and policy to be support by the Eu . </s>
we refocus development policy on poverty reduction strategy . </s>
we base the allocation of fund not only on an assessment of each country 's need , but also of its policy performance . </s>
we create an investment facility to support the development of the private sector . </s>
we rationalise instrument and introduce a new system of roll programming , allow the Community and the beneficiary country to regularly adjust their cooperation programme . </s>
we decentralise administrative and , in some case , financial responsibility to local level with the aim of make cooperation more effective . </s>
we improve the policy framework for trade and investment development . </s>
we enhance cooperation in all area important to trade , include new issue such as labour standard and the linkage between environment and trade . </s>
after Seattle I be sure you will appreciate the significance of these agreement . </s>
let me turn to some of the more important point . </s>
firstly the agreement on political issue . </s>
the new agreement will entail a firm commitment on both side to good governance as a fundamental and positive element of the partnership , a subject for regular dialogue in an area which enjoy active Community support . </s>
secondly , a new procedure have be draw up for case of violation of human right , democratic principle and the rule of law . </s>
in comparison with the current procedure , the new one put more emphasis on the responsibility of the state concern and allow for great flexibility in the consultation process , with a view to conduct an effective dialogue lead to measure to be take to redress the situation . </s>
in case of special urgency involve serious violation of one of these essential element , measure will be take immediately and the other party will be notify . </s>
thirdly , the Eu and the ACP have also agree on a new specific procedure to be launch in serious case of corruption . </s>
this be a real innovation , both in the EU / ACP context and in international relation in general . </s>
this procedure will be apply , not only in case of corruption involve EDF money , but also more widely in any country where the EC be financially involve and where corruption constitute an obstacle to development . </s>
it be thus not confine to EC activity . </s>
this be a very important aspect , take into account the fundability of public finance . </s>
by adopt such a provision in the partnership agreement , the Eu and the ACP States be together send a clear and positive signal that will doubtless be appreciate by European taxpayer and hopefully also by European investor . </s>
another new theme in the ACP-EU agreement be migration . </s>
we have reach a balanced agreement on cooperation in this area . </s>
this new dimension to the partnership agreement reflect the guideline espouse by the Eu in accordance with the Treaty of Amsterdam and with the conclusion of the European Council in Tampere in Finland in October @card@ . </s>
the European Union undertake to develop and implement an immigration and asylum policy found on the principle of partnership with the originate country and region . </s>
the agreement conclude with the ACP country pave the way for new initiative , in particular on the right of third country citizen within the Eu , and measure facilitate their integration . </s>
we also agree on provision to address question relate to illegal immigration . </s>
the Eu and the ACP state will initiate the process aim ultimately at define , within a framework to be negotiate with each and every ACP country , the way and mean of repatriate immigrant illegally present on the territory of each party . </s>
this also cover person from third country and stateless person . </s>
these very innovative approach provide a good opportunity to improve governance . </s>
the agreement also offer a good framework to underpin the mutually reinforce effect of trade cooperation and development aid . </s>
we have agree on a process to establish new trading arrangement that will pursue trade liberalisation between the party and to formulate provision on trade-related matter . </s>
we have meet the concern of the ACP state as far as the time-frame of the trade negotiation be concern . </s>
negotiation will start no later than @card@ . </s>
this two-year preparatory period will be use to strengthen regional integration process and the ACP country ' capacity to conduct trade negotiation . </s>
a six-year period be programme for these negotiation . </s>
we will take account of the economic and social constraint of the ACP country in two way : firstly , through human and social development policy to accompany economic and trade reform and , secondly , by help the ACP state to become active player in the international economic and trade system through capacity-building and cooperation in multilateral forum . </s>
this approach will lead us to a fully WTO compatible regime . </s>
economic operator will be more incline to establish close relation with their ACP partner . </s>
domestic and foreign investment will grow and more know-how and technology will be transfer , all of which will boost the ACP country ' competitiveness and ease their gradual integration into the world economy . </s>
in addition , the agreement with the Eu will act as an anchor . </s>
they will lock in the economic reform , just as national and economic reform will be stabilise by both party ' commitment under the agreement . </s>
the rationale behind this new approach be also base on the idea that open trade policy combine with social development policy will lead to economic growth and poverty reduction . </s>
another important aspect be the improvement of the Eu 's trade regime for all least-developed country , @card@ of which be actually in the ACP group . </s>
this process will take place in the come five year so that , by @card@ , the LDC ' exporter will have free access for essentially all their product on the Eu market . </s>
as regard the volume of the next EDF , the Eu have make its financial proposal . </s>
it be base on the principle of reconcile the need to maintain a substantial amount of financial resource in a period of limited official development assistance budget with the need to make Community aid more effective . </s>
today about EUR @card@ billion of previous EDF resource be uncommitted . </s>
the Eu be commit to mobilise these remain balance , plus the new EDF resource , over a seven-year period , that be to say , before the entry into force of the next financial protocol . </s>
this will enable the Community to substantially increase annual flow of commitment and payment during this period . </s>
we be thus not move into a period in the come year of reduce activity , we be move into a period of increase activity . </s>
such a commitment entail an in-depth reform of procedure and implementation modality on both side . </s>
There be a very real link between the reform process in the Commission as such , and our ability to deliver on the ground which be the basis of the deal with the ACP country . </s>
turn to our development policy , I would say that the global context have change drastically . </s>
the marginalisation of many economy , increase poverty in the world , the need for good management of environmental interdependence , the destabilising effect of migration and the worry consequence of armed conflict and pandemic disease be all major concern . </s>
it be within this change global framework that we have to position ourselves . </s>
fortunately evaluation of EC aid give us a meaningful tool to improve what we be do and also hopefully to meet the challenge I have just mention . </s>
To focus on the input come from the evaluation , I would mention the follow problem : the objection of Community policy be too numerous and too vague and this adversely affect coherence . </s>
this be due to the complexity of our own structure , but also to very real inconsistency between sector policy and interest in the Member States . </s>
the Commission have an aid system that be too complex and fragmented in term of instrument , procedure and institutional mechanism . </s>
often policy be more determine by the instrument available , than by policy objective and clearly-defined priority . </s>
human resource be too thin in relation to the volume of aid that we be suppose to manage . </s>
on average , to manage $ US @card@ million of aid there be @card@ staff at the Commission , compare with @card@ at the World Bank and between 4 and 9 in major Member States . </s>
this be a real problem : there be too many different financial instrument , each with its own characteristic and in particular a series of different budget heading . </s>
this be difficult to reconcile with the need of an effective management system . </s>
in order to face and solve these problem the community need to engage in an effective dialogue with Member States and Parliament . </s>
it be absolutely crucial that we tackle the coherence issue in a realistic and pragmatic way , which mean hold the debate in the appropriate institutional framework , that be , the Council and Parliament . </s>
the lack of concerted action among the @card@ Member state themselves and between them and the Community also need to be address . </s>
by focus the Community 's development policy on internationally agree target and strategy we will pave the way for good complementarity with the Member States . </s>
this be very much the line also just present by Minister Amado . </s>
when we talk policy nowadays , we engage in a process of convergence . </s>
this be part of the solution . </s>
we be in the process of formulate new policy guideline and we need to identify priority area for Community action . </s>
Everything have become more and more complex . </s>
this be also true of development cooperation . </s>
no single donor be in a position to address the whole spectrum of theme , range from macro-economic issue to the regulatory framework or from sectoral policy to a variety of new cross-cutting theme such as gender , environment , good governance and institutional reform . </s>
it be important to find flexible mechanism that accommodate a division of labour accord to the expertise and capacity of the various donor in each develop country . </s>
this should be do at Member State level and should lead to the formulation of sector policy for Community action . </s>
this be where we want to go . </s>
To identify the EC 's priority area of support , account have to be take of the Community 's specific feature in relation to the Member States and to international institution . </s>
I will mention just a few : our ability to combine development policy with trade policy and to ensure synergy between aid and economic cooperation ; our neutrality and defence of overall Community interest ; the fact that we represent a critical mass and be able to do relatively large job compare to what individual Member States can normally do . </s>
also , our presence on the ground : basically , I find the big value we represent be the very fact that be a successful regional cooperation endeavour ourselves , we be see as a neutral , welcome partner for this experiment world-wide - something which nobody else can claim to be . </s>
it be vital to make Community policy more effective and to develop a more operational strategic framework . </s>
it be this dual challenge that the Commission have to take up , by frame in the month ahead a proposal for a general policy statement . </s>
we will launch a broad and open consultation process in order to get the view of all the different party interested . </s>
I see the process not quite but almost as important as the content and we will put all our resource into participate actively and we invite everybody to participate . </s>
parallel to this we have also embark on the process of improve coherence and clarify and bring to the surface and into the open the real or imaginary problem we be have in this respect . </s>
this will be an ongoing process which I see as a kind of continued quality control effort and I invite Parliament to participate in this ongoing effort to improve the coherence of what we be do . </s>

Mr President , Mr President-in-Office of the Council , Commissioner , lady and gentleman , follow the same line as Mrs Maij-Weggen , I believe that we have a number of representative here who all feel passionate about contribute to this debate . </s>

article @card@ , Title XX of the consolidated treaty of the European Union read as follow : &quot; the Community shall take account of the objective refer to in Article @card@ in the policy that it implement which be likely to affect develop country &quot; . </s>
What be the objective which each Eu policy need to take into account ? </s>
article @card@ specify these objective as &quot; sustainable economic and social development of the develop country , and more particularly the most disadvantaged among them &quot; , the &quot; smooth and gradual integration of the develop country into the world economy and the campaign against poverty in the develop country &quot; . </s>
Mr President , these be no arbitrary objective . </s>
these be article , statutory article , which form part of the European acquis establish by law with which the European institution and Member States must comply . </s>
every statutory article should , of course , not just be judge on its regularity , but also on the importance of its content . </s>
I be of the opinion - and luckily I be not alone in this - that the principle of policy coherence be essential to every government which aim to be a credible servant of its citizen . </s>
the interest of the citizen be only serve by a credible and reliable government . </s>
this be important if the government want to gain the trust of society , and also important from the point of view of effectiveness , for coherence be require in order to use the restricted mean efficiently . </s>
we should not make reality out to be more rose-tinted than it really be . </s>
reality be obstinate . </s>
it be up to the government to deal with this fact in a transparent and open manner , without any backhandedness . </s>
the government be oblige to show up any of its dilemma , and to show where , when and why , problem occur with coherence of policy , rather than sweep it all under the carpet . </s>
What we be talk about here today be not an issue which can be toy with at leisure . </s>
poverty in the third world be a harrow problem that demand urgent attention . </s>
it be only natural that we in Parliament guard the interest of our citizen , but it be also in the interest of our citizen to live in a stable , international environment , in which the goal of human safety be pursue . </s>
this be a moral interest , a safety interest and be , ultimately , even in the interest of our economy . </s>
in whose interest be it really if European taxpayer ' money be use to support economic development in Namibia , and if , at the same time , the economic activity of poor cattle farmer in the same country be drastically undercut by rigorous export subsidy , finance by the same tax payer ? </s>
we be all act as if this be not really happen , but we all know that it be . </s>
it be not our task as MEPs to adopt an ostrich policy and bury our head in the sand . </s>
the general interest of policy coherence be , therefore , a responsibility of the Commission as a whole , of the Council , and of the European Parliament . </s>
this responsibility can only be bear by the Commissioner for Development and Humanitarian Aid , however much we like to see him or hear him talk , or by the Development Council or the parliamentary Committee on Development and Cooperation . </s>
What we need here be an integral approach . </s>
after the lucid and closely reason explanation of this approach present by both Mr Amado and Mr Nielson , I would like to note that we be very much look forward to the proposal , not only by Mr Nielson , but by the entire Commission , in order to make the policy coherent as a whole . </s>
this be why we urge the Commission , in this sharp and clear resolution , to develop specific instrument . </s>
we need to pinpoint , and draw up an inventory of , the problem area for coherence . </s>
we need to make it evident which problem we be solve and which we have not yet solve . </s>
this be why I advocate a monitor centre for coherence which make this apparent . </s>
this be why we need to set up inter-service task group in the Commission , in the Council and in Parliament which can police the attainment of coherence . </s>
Mr President , lady and gentleman , if our neighbour 's roof be leak , we can lend him pot and pan to collect the water , but it be , of course , more effective to help him plug the leak in the roof . </s>

Mr President , let us be clear from the outset : when it come to cooperation , coherence be far from be the watchword . </s>
the treaty provide for the European Union to help develop country to develop but , as the previous speaker have explain so well , there be various distortion to these declaration . </s>
the first area of incoherence be the lack of consultation between the Union and the Member States on individual cooperation policy . </s>
this give rise to serious malfunction , because some Community programme duplicate national programme , whereas they might have help other project about which nothing be do . </s>
and let us not forget that the de facto neo-colonial policy of certain Member States do nothing to help the country which they be supposedly help to develop . </s>
the second area of incoherence be aid to authoritarian regime . </s>
we state that good governance and an end to corruption be mandatory but we continue to pour hundred of thousand of euros into Swiss bank account via the portfolio of a number of Heads of State . </s>
the third area of incoherence be human right . </s>
we say that we want to protect human right . </s>
we encourage develop country to respect human right . </s>
we even adopt numerous resolution condemn every violation of human right . </s>
we ally ourselves with demonstration and international campaign . </s>
and yet , at the same time , we allow the arm trade to proliferate and do not even attempt to limit the trade in the most atrocious form of arm such as anti-personnel mine . </s>
nor do we do much to really prevent human right violation . </s>
the fourth area of incoherence in the European Union 's cooperation policy be this : how do you expect to help development by pillage the natural resource of the people you be help . </s>
the European Union must leave fish for local fisherman to feed local population instead of systematically destroy maritime resource through intensive fishery . </s>
we must leave raw material so that local manufacturer can process them . </s>
I will not even mention oil ; we be all aware of the policy of group such as Elf and Total in Africa . </s>
furthermore , and this will perhaps soon be the fifth area of incoherence , we demand respect for biodiversity , for example so that everyone can produce from their own seed and preserve the richness of nature ; but at the same time , and this be apparent during recent negotiation , we force ACP country to sign trip agreement . </s>
these agreement risk be extend to live organism , which would mean the death of biodiversity and the return of de facto slavery for small-scale farmer in the south , at the hand of the multinational . </s>
and yet , and this be the sixth area of incoherence , we do not defend the application of the current treaty . </s>
on the one hand , we vote for a budget line for the fight against AIDS and , on the other hand , we do nothing to ensure compliance with mandatory licence within the framework of the very same trip , despite the fact that this would allow develop country to produce their own medicine and halt the AIDS massacre . </s>
similarly , during the WTO negotiation , at a time when , to quote the second paragraph of the Schwaiger report , &quot; the current trade liberalisation process have not yet bring significant benefit for large part of the population of develop country , especially the poor &quot; , the European Union continue to defend the liberalisation of trade and intend to put an end to the system of favour ACP country , albeit with a transitional period of several year , instead of strengthen it , especially for the poor country . </s>
the eighth area of incoherence be of a political and practical nature . </s>
we be always say think globally , act locally . </s>

however , let me reflect that concern by refer to three controversial issue : the death penalty , Cuba and China . </s>
I be go to be so unwise as to allow one or two personal reflection to creep into my remark . </s>
we be currently review the option and possibility for introduce a death penalty resolution in the Human Rights Commission . </s>
this have always be a subject about which I personally have feel extremely strongly , I have always vote against the death penalty . </s>

we have to freeze our resolution on the death penalty or risk the passing of a resolution that would have incorporate wholly unacceptable argument that assert that human right be not universally applicable and valid . </s>
the New York stage be different from Geneva . </s>
last year 's debate in New York on sovereignty and humanitarian intervention be such a sensitive topic that it influence all other issue . </s>
it certainly influence the debate on the moratorium on the death penalty . </s>
the debate in Geneva , however , be more focus on human right issue . </s>
we may therefore stand a good chance of make progress there . </s>
secondly , Cuba . </s>
I want to address this issue directly because we in Europe be criticise unfairly for not take human right there sufficiently seriously . </s>
we be extremely concern about move by the Cuban government over the last year that have further curtail public freedom , move like change in the penal code and the scope of the death penalty . </s>
we be also worry by the recent increase in the number of political detention . </s>
we be monitor the human right situation through the report of NGOs and the work of our human right work group base in the Eu embassy in Havana . </s>
we have regularly put our criticism to the Cuban authority , and this Parliament have do the same . </s>
but I do not believe that the right approach be to try to isolate Cuba . </s>
we want a fair and open society in Cuba , a Cuba which respect the principle of the market , the sanctity of contract and the rule of law . </s>
we want to encourage a process of transition to democracy and respect for human right and fundamental freedom . </s>
my view be exactly the same when it come to the third subject with which I wish to deal , namely China . </s>
quite simply , I want us to be engage with China . </s>
it would be self-indulgent and self-defeat , as well as insulting to over a fifth of humanity , to want anything else . </s>
I also want to see a China transform by peaceful change into a free pluralist society which do not lock up democracy activist or religious believer . </s>
so what should we do ? </s>
naturally we should trade enthusiastically with China and hope that we can welcome China into the World Trade Organisation on sensible term . </s>
it be a misnomer to talk about a World Trade Organisation which do not include China - or Russia , for that matter . </s>
but I do not believe today , nor have I ever believe , that our burgeon economic relationship with China - manifest , for example , by China 's EUR @card@ billion surplus with the European Union - should silence us when it come to China 's human right record . </s>
for me the question be not whether we should address the question of human right in China - we have a duty to do so and a legitimate interest in do so - but rather what be the most effective way of do this ? </s>
so what should be our attitude towards a Geneva resolution this year ? </s>
as the presidency have note , the Union as a whole be consider its position . </s>
but I strongly suggest there be a number of factor of which the Member States ought to take proper account . </s>
first , while some people question whether table a Geneva resolution make any difference , several of the most distinguished Chinese advocate of democracy strongly believe that it be a valuable move , not least because of the message it send to people in China itself . </s>
that be a point that deserve serious consideration . </s>
secondly , we will all want to take proper account of what have actually be happen in China in recent month , for instance , the heavy sentence impose on democracy campaigner , the detention and recent punishment mete out to member of Christian church and the arrest and sentence of the member of Falun Gong . </s>
Chinese leader be in no doubt about our position on all these issue and on development in Tibet . </s>
we have make our view very clear to them . </s>
while we all know that for many people in China there have be a real long-term improvement in their economic prospect and their social and economic liberty , there be a dark side to the picture as well . </s>
critic of table a resolution say that at least we now have a human right dialogue with China . </s>
that be true and potentially valuable , although I have to say - and I have say to Chinese official as have the presidency - that there have not be nearly as much content to our dialogue as we would have like . </s>
of course the dialogue have enable us to identify and implement Eu cooperation programme in the human right and legal sphere . </s>
that be very welcome and I also believe that our village governance programme should help to promote democracy at grassroots level . </s>
naturally any dialogue as complex as the one on human right be go to be a long-term process , but I wish I could point to more real gain . </s>
the next dialogue in Lisbon on @card@ February will be an important test . </s>
it will show whether the dialogue be produce result or not . </s>
What , finally , do we want to see as the first step ? </s>
well , for example , we would like to see China move from sign the UN Conventions on Civil and Political Rights and on Social and Cultural Rights toward actually ratify them . </s>
I wish we be closer to that . </s>
where do all that leave us this year ? </s>
I repeat that Member States will have to make up their mind . </s>
What I hope be , first , that we in Europe will adopt a common position and stick to it , that we will not allow some to be pick off , that our position will not be base on self-delusion or pretence , that it will be a common position and a sensible position . </s>
I know that some people say we must have a good way of press our concern about human right than through table resolution . </s>
but if that be true , then at the very least we need to be more imaginative and honest with ourselves in look for that way forward . </s>
if we be to rest our position on the human right dialogue , then we need to be able to convince you , the Ngo community and the public at large that it be actually get somewhere . </s>
that , in my judgement , be the challenge for the next few week . </s>
I be grateful to the house for its concern about human right around the world , and particularly in China . </s>
thank you very much , Commissioner Patten . </s>
we will now interrupt the debate on the joint statement concern the next session of the UN Human Rights Commission and proceed to the vote . </s>

that conclude the explanation of vote . </s>

by that I mean the use , and often abuse , of embargo during recent year , and the over-cautious application of the clause allow suspension of the agreement between the European Union and third country , where there have be human right violation . </s>

we should therefore do what be necessary to update the area in which we can intervene , with renew strength , to safeguard human right . </s>
in that context I would mention the following : social right , worker ' right , quality of work , the need to ensure respect , where necessary , for all the criterion lay down by the International Labour Organisation , the right to tolerance and to respect - a right to which all minority be entitle , particularly within the European Union . </s>
I would also mention the right to develop . </s>
it be the right of all people who , in turn , be the sum of countless individual each one of whom have the right to develop and to a future that , most importantly , be full of hope and personal growth , within each individual society . </s>
All those aspect should be part of a rationale , a discourse and a contribution which the European Union should bring to human right . </s>
I hope that Parliament 's participation in the Geneva session turn out to be more than just a token presence and that its representative do more than just listen to and give evidence . </s>

that be what we hope for and be the cordial message that we be send our government , even if it go against their interest . </s>

Mr President , lady and gentleman , on behalf of the Presidency of the Council of the European Union , I would like to present to you certain information about the re-opening of the intra-Cyprus negotiation and recent development in this area . </s>
I think it will be obvious to everyone that the event in Helsinki at the end of last year and the new era in relation between the European Union and Turkey have create a new backdrop , at Community level , which we can ignore when it come to relation between the two Cypriot community . </s>
at the beginning of December @card@ , the first round of negotiation be hold in New York , after an interruption of several year in negotiation between the Cypriot community in the north and south of the island . </s>
these negotiation take the form of indirect discussion mediate by the UN special representative , Álvaro de Soto . </s>
a further round be hold in January this year , start on @card@ January , and a third round be schedule to start on @card@ May in New York . </s>
There be a possibility , which have not yet be absolutely confirm , that continuous and direct discussion may take place , with work continue until September this year . </s>
these discussion essentially cover four area : security , the structure of government , territorial adjustment and issue relate to refugee and compensation , as a result of the situation follow the partition of the island . </s>
however , agreement have also be reach on the possibility of include other issue , and the representative of the northern part of the island , Rauf Denktash , have suggest three new topic : sovereignty , confidence-build measure and the issue of lift the embargo on product from the north of the island . </s>
the discussion hold so far have essentially result in two development . </s>
the first be the possibility of open up a direct information channel between the European Union and the north of the island , without this necessarily signify recognition of this part of the island as a legal personality at international level , but as a means of facilitate adoption of the acquis communautaire with a view to eventual accession of the whole island , if a solution can , in the meantime , be find to the broad problem of the partition of the island . </s>
the second development which we regard as important be the statement make by the Secretary-General of the United Nations at the end of the first day 's discussion to the effect that an overall settlement of the situation would involve recognition of the specific situation of the north of the island . </s>
this be the position of the Secretary-General of the United Nations and it will therefore have to form part of our future analysis . </s>
certain expectation exist about the third round of negotiation , in view of the propose scenario be prepare with the involvement of representative of the United States and the United Kingdom , in particular in the area of security and the constitutional structure , which it be envisage will be present at this round through the good office of the representative of the Secretary-General of the United Nations . </s>
this will take place after the election in the north of the island schedule for @card@ April . </s>
furthermore , the Portuguese Presidency of the European Union have decide , follow the example of previous presidency , to appoint a representative to establish contact with the various party involve in this issue . </s>
this representative have already contact all these party and have , in close cooperation with the representative of the Secretary-General of the United Nations , be monitor and assist with the work of the various round . </s>
in particular , we intend that the European Union should maintain a constant profile on this issue , and of course all the more so since Cyprus be a candidate for membership of the European union with negotiation at a fairly advanced stage . </s>
this naturally raise certain expectation and mean that the role of the European Union be of some relevance in this context . </s>
the approach that we have be follow in these discussion , and our participation in them , essentially turn on take advantage of a certain desire to alleviate the tension that exist , base on a conviction - which appear to be widely share - that it be necessary to continue to negotiate , and that continue negotiation and maintain their impetus also give rise to hope that a definitive solution can be find . </s>
There be also another important aspect which I refer to at the beginning of my statement , and this relate to Turkey 's role in help the north of the island to prepare for accession . </s>
we believe that it be not only necessary to read the conclusion of the Helsinki European Council with some care and attention , but that we should also take advantage of the willingness of the Turkish authority to help to resolve this situation . </s>
I be able to talk to Prime Minister Bülent Ecevit about this issue when I visit Ankara myself , and although we be aware of the difficulty and sensitivity associate with Turkey 's particular approach to this question , I believe that there be a window of opportunity that we must not miss . </s>
this window of opportunity involve combine various factor , one of which - and let us be frank about this - be the nature of the relationship between Turkey and the European Union . </s>
this be key as regard the future of this issue . </s>
on the other hand , we think it be important - and this be also link with the way in which the European Union relate to the heart of this matter - that an exchange of information between the Commission and the Cypriot in the north of the island should be encourage . </s>
this would not , let me make this quite clear , imply any kind of formal recognition . </s>
nevertheless , we believe , and I think this be also how the Commission see thing , that the whole process of approximation with the acquis communautaire with a view to overall integration of the island in the European union through accession at some point in the future imply involve the community in the north of the island as soon as possible . </s>
it may also give the European Union access to datum enable it to justify accession , as part of its effort to assess accession condition . </s>
furthermore , this mean that we in the Council - and I think that Parliament will join us in this - should encourage the Commission 's involvement in this undertaking . </s>
it be essential for us to send the Commission a message of confidence about its role in this area . </s>
lastly , I believe - and this be also the presidency 's intention - that we should continue to cooperate actively with the United Nations , give the skilful , intelligent and capable way in which the Secretary-General , and the UN organisation in general , have conduct these discussion , and in particular the way they have endeavour to help to harmonise the two party ' position . </s>
as I say at the beginning , the conclusion of the Helsinki European Council last December have have a visible impact on the way the position of the various party to this process have develop . </s>
the Nicosia Government have express its satisfaction with the Helsinki conclusion , which open up the way to accession to the European union without solve the partition of the island beforehand . </s>
nevertheless , I have to say that the same authority have express their concern about the pressure they may come under to resolve the issue raise by partition , which will evidently imply some concession . </s>
this be relate to development in the sphere of displace people and the possibility of a new arrangement regard displace people should a different solution be find for the island . </s>
on the other hand , the Turkish Cypriot fear - and there be no point in try to conceal this - that Turkey 's application for membership of the European Union may lead to great flexibility in Ankara 's position on this . </s>
I believe that , despite the fear that may be feel by the two community on the island , these point , which could be view in a negative light by the authority on both side , may in the end justify hope of an ultimate solution . </s>
it be very clear that this solution will involve one of the most important aspect of relation in this area at present , which be the extremely positive trend in relation between Athens and Ankara and the very important part play in these relation by the Greek Foreign Minister , Giorgios Papandreou , and the Turkish Foreign Minister , Ismail Cem . </s>
we believe that this have create the framework for a positive outcome . </s>

in other word , for many citizen , and not just in your country , you personify the European value to which we constantly voice our attachment . </s>

your country file an official application to join the Union in @card@ and accession negotiation be finally officially open in @card@ . </s>

Mr President , it give me great pleasure to give you the floor . </s>
( applause ) Madam President , member of the European Parliament , lady and gentleman , the question of whether , deep down , a European have a sense of European identity , alongside a sense or awareness of national identity , crop up time and time again nowadays . </s>
in other word , do Europeans really feel they be European or be it more of an abstract idea , a theoretical concept design to repackage a geographical factor as a state of mind ? </s>
this question also crop up during the debate on the degree of sovereignty which the nation state can and should transfer to the institution of the European Union . </s>
some insist that if a clearly-felt national identity be eclipse too quickly by a European identity which few feel , or which be even perceive as fanciful , then thing be sure to take a turn for the bad . </s>
so what exactly do we mean by Europeanism ? </s>
if I look deep into my heart and try to identify the point at which I start to feel European , and what unite me to Europe , the first thing I feel be mild surprise at the fact that it be only now , under the pressure of topical political issue and duty , that I even ask myself the question . </s>
why do I not put this question to myself a long time ago , when I start to make my way in the world and reflect on the world and my place in it ? </s>
do I consider my attachment to Europe as a purely extrinsic factor of little significance , a factor which do not need to concern , let alone torment , me ? </s>
or , on the contrary , do I consider my Europeanism as so self-evident that it do not warrant interrogation , examination or further think ? </s>
the second proposition be the more likely : everything with which I have always identify myself be so naturally European that it never occur to me to consider it as such . </s>
I simply do not see any point in qualify it or , generally , in associate my way of think with a specific continent . </s>
furthermore , I have the feeling that , as a young man , I might well have feel slightly silly say or write that I be a European , that my perception and way of thinking be European or even explicitly claim that I be from Europe . </s>
it would have seem profoundly pathetic and presumptuous , a more arrogant version of the national patriotism which have always embarrass me . </s>
in other word , I be so obviously and naturally European that I do not even think about it . </s>
and I be sure that apply to the majority of Europeans . </s>
they be profoundly European but they be not even aware of it , they do not hang that label round their neck , which be why opinion poll show that they be somewhat surprise at have to shout their Europeanism from the rooftop . </s>
There do not appear to be a great tradition of consider Europeanism in Europe . </s>
that be not necessarily a good thing and I welcome with satisfaction the fact that our Europeanism be start to emerge clearly today from the vast melting pot of concept which &quot; speak for themselves &quot; . </s>
question , consider and try to define it , help us enormously in understand ourselves . </s>
it be become a determine factor in the multicultural and multifaceted world in which we live , in which the capacity to perceive one 's own identity be a prerequisite to peaceful coexistence with other identity . </s>
moreover , if Europe have think so little about its own identity in the past , that be no doubt because it consider itself , wrongly , to be the entire world ; or at least it consider itself to be good than the rest of the world , because it do not feel the need to define itself in relation to other . </s>
which , of course , have unfortunate consequence as far as its actual conduct be concern . </s>
think about Europeanism mean ask what set of value , ideal or principle put you in mind of the notion of Europe , even what be typical of Europe . </s>
more than that , it also mean start from the very essence of the thing , examine the whole concept critically . </s>
and , hence , quickly realise that numerous European tradition , value or principle be typically highly ambiguous and may lead to ruin if exaggerate , exploit or abuse . </s>
if Europe have enter an era of self-examination , that mean that it wish to define itself in relation to other and , also , that it want to identify what be good about itself , what have prove its worth and what should be retain for the future . </s>
when I first have the honour of address this House six year ago , I mention the need to emphasise the spiritual dimension , and the importance of the value of European integration , and I confide my fear that the spiritual , historic , political and civilise aspect of Europe might be hijack by question of a technical , economic , financial or administrative nature which risk upset the public . </s>
at the time , my word sound somewhat provocative and I expect to be boo out of the House . </s>
but no such thing happen and it be satisfy to note that these same word now no longer sound provocative at all . </s>
the dramatic change in Europe since the iron curtain fall ten year ago , the increasingly obvious need to enlarge the European Union , faster and faster economic integration and the array of new threat be generate by present circumstance be also factor which have force the European Union to open its mind to renewed , more intense introspection and to identify and redefine the value which unite it and give it purpose . </s>
the idea be occasionally moot that this quest have come too late , that cultural and political integration and introspection should have precede economic integration ; in other word , that we have start from the wrong end . </s>
I do not think that be a fair judgement . </s>
after the Second World War , democratic western Europe have to deal with the memory of the horror of two world war and the threat of the spread of totalitarian communism . </s>
at the time , it be almost superfluous to discuss which value need to be protect . </s>
they stick out a mile . </s>
on the contrary , the west need to unite technically , as it be , post haste , in order to prevent the possible emergence or even the proliferation of dictatorship and a relapse into old national conflict . </s>
doubtless the same apply to my feeling of Europeanism : it come to me so naturally over the year , or even the decade , that it do not even occur to me to claim it explicitly . </s>
for western Europe , everything which it need to protect be so obvious that it do not feel any press need to define it , analyse it , pull it apart or translate it into various political or institutional act . </s>
thus , just as I have only now come to ask myself if I feel European and to consider what that mean , so the democratic Europe under construction have doubtless be force by the historic event of the last decade to reflect on the very basis for its unification and its objective in great depth . </s>
in my view , the main European value , as shape by the turbulent spiritual and political history of Europe , and as adopt by other part of the world , or at least some part of the world , be obvious . </s>
respect for the individual and for his freedom , his right and his dignity , the principle of solidarity , equality before the law and the rule of law , protection of all ethnic minority , democratic institution , separation of the legislative , executive and judicial estate , political pluralism , respect for private property and free enterprise , a market economy and the development of the civil society . </s>
the form which these value currently assume naturally reflect countless modern European experience , include the fact that our continent be become a main multicultural crossroad . </s>
I should like to dwell , for reason which I shall explain , on one of these fundamental value . </s>
I refer to the civil society . </s>
in the western world , i. e. in today 's Euro-American world , a richly construct , open , decentralise civil society base on trust in the sovereign independence of its citizen and their various association , form the basis of the democratic state and guarantee its political stability . </s>
if the European Union be shortly to open its door to new democracy and , in my view , it be in its vital interest to do so , it be extremely important , if not of capital importance , that it help to reconstruct and develop the civil society in these country . </s>
it be not by chance that , shortly after it come to power , the communist dictatorship shredded and then eradicate the fabric of civil society as quickly as possible . </s>
it know full well that it would never gain real control of the people while the various grass-roots structure of the civil society continue to function . </s>
What remain of a genuine civil society live and develop in direct or indirect resistance . </s>
and European value survive in this milieu not thank to the political regime , but in spite of it . </s>
the way in which society structure itself can , of course , be impose from on high . </s>
but the climate and the condition which be conducive to its development can be put in place . </s>
in this sense , aid for new democracy should be give in the wide context of the sustainable development and reinforcement of the civil society at pan-European level . </s>
the more varied , differentiate and interlink the various civil European structure , the more willing the new democracy will be to join them and the faster the principle of trust in the citizen and subsidiarity will apply in them , thereby reinforce their stability . </s>
but that be not all : the foundation of the European union as a supranational community will grow all the strong . </s>
specifically , that mean that one of the first job be to transfer certain social solidarity task to local authority and non-profit-making or public-sector organisation . </s>
the low the level at which resource be redistribute , the more transparent and economic this redistribution will be , provide good coverage of the multifarious need of society , which be difficult to define from the centre , and create social solidarity which be all the more genuine for be distinctly link to specific person or association of person . </s>
this genuine solidarity between citizen , social group , community and region be the good basis for solidarity which can be dispense by a single entity , I. E. the state . </s>
and in a supranational entity as big as the European Union , which need to function as an instrument of solidarity , the real civil foundation must be even more strong and even rich . </s>
the viability of the European Union therefore depend mainly , perhaps above all , on the spirit in which its citizen accept a civil European identity . </s>
an increase awareness of all the symptom or manifestation of national egotism , xenophobia or racial intolerance should clearly form part of this new sense of European identity . </s>
the policy of appeasement which culminate in the capitulation to evil in Munich be one of the bitter chapter of modern European history . </s>
this experience should encourage us to be vigilant . </s>
evil need to be nip in the bud and it be not enough that there be government to do so . </s>
the attitude of government should be inform by the attitude of its citizen . </s>
the concern for security be another expression of social solidarity . </s>
this be the job of the state or of a supranational grouping . </s>
the European Union have start work intensively on a new concept for its security policy . </s>
the overriding feature of this policy should be its capacity to take decision quickly and transform them equally quickly into action . </s>
I think that be extremely important . </s>
it be also high time . </s>
surely , recent experience in Yugoslavia have a great deal to teach us on this subject . </s>
in my view , the intervention by NATO demonstrate several thing quite clearly . </s>
first , respect for life and human dignity and the concern for European security may , under certain circumstance , call for intervention beyond the border of the European Union . </s>
of course , the strong the mandate for such intervention , the well . </s>
however , one can also imagine the unfortunate situation in which there be no UN mandate and yet intervention be in the interest of the whole of Europe and human civilisation as we know it . </s>
I be not convince that Europe be prepare , even recently , to deal with such a disastrous eventuality . </s>
it be certainly more prepare now , at least psychologically , and I think that it should capitalise on this and finalise its material and technical arrangement . </s>
secondly , more effort need to be make in the area of preventive security . </s>
in Kosovo and Serbia , as in Bosnia-Herzegovina and other part of former Yugoslavia , ten of thousand of human life and countless property could have be save if the international community have be capable of appropriate reaction earlier , when the conflict break out . </s>
( applause ) unfortunately , despite all the appeal , despite all the warning of possible or imminent atrocity , nothing happen . </s>
One of the possible , conceivable reason be a preoccupation with a variety of individual and material interest and the inability of government team to rake risk in the name of a good cause and the great good . </s>
thirdly , the United States play the lead role in this particular instance and it be highly probable that , without their intervention , the international community , not know what to do , would today still be witness the atrocity which lead to intervention in Kosovo . </s>
but Europe can rely indefinitely on the United States , especially when it come to European problem . </s>
it should be capable of find a solution and resolve the situation itself . </s>
it be unthinkable in today 's world , where small entity legitimately unite in international or supranational community , that the European Union can continue to be a respected member of the world order if it be unable to agree on how to defend human right , not only on its own territory but within its sphere of action , i. e. in the area which may , one day , belong to it . </s>
I think , as I say a moment ago , that enlargement be in the vital interest of the European Union . </s>
allow me to reiterate and highlight this conviction . </s>
it stem perhaps from the experience of a man who live for forty year under communist rule , precede by Nazi domination , or from the individual experience of an inhabitant of a country at the very centre of Europe which , over the century , have become the crossroad of various spiritual current and European geopolitical interest , even the birthplace of more than one European conflict . </s>
All this lead me to the firm conviction that Europe be the only political entity whose security must be undivided . </s>
the idea of two Europe live cheek by jowl , the idea of a democratic , stable , prosperous Europe on the road to integration and a less democratic , less stable and less prosperous Europe be , in my view , completely illusory . </s>
it sound like the idea of sustainable coexistence in a room which be half flood and half dry . </s>
despite its difference , Europe be indivisible , and anything serious which happen to it will have repercussion on , and consequence for , the rest of the continent . </s>
as a single political entity , Europe have an opportunity today which it have never have throughout its turbulent history ; the opportunity to construct a profoundly fair and peaceful order base on the principle of equality and cooperation by all side . </s>
no more act of violence perpetrate by the powerful on the less powerful ; instead , understanding and general consensus , however difficult they be and however long they take to achieve , should be the guiding principle behind the structure and stability of Europe in the next millennium . </s>
in this context , I understand Europe to mean the continent as a whole . </s>
we all know that the process of enlargement of the European Union need to be accompany by continual and ambitious reform of its institution . </s>
I be sure that the Intergovernmental Conference will make realistic proposal which will send the European union in the right direction . </s>
however , institutional change within the European Union must not stop there . </s>
on the contrary , it must be the start of a very long process , possibly take several decade , in which the overriding concern be to speed up and simplify decision-making within the European Union and make it more transparent . </s>
allow me to mention two more specific point which I have allude to on several occasion and which could , in my view , help to achieve these objective in the more distant future . </s>
first , I believe that the European Union should , sooner or later , have a clear , accurate , universally understandable constitution ... ( Applause ) ... a constitution which every child in Europe can simply learn at school . </s>
this constitution would comprise two part , as be standard practice . </s>
the first part would set out the fundamental right and duty of the European citizen and state , the fundamental value on which a unite Europe be base and the sense and purpose of the European structure . </s>
the second would describe the main institution of the European Union , their main power and the relation between them . </s>
the fact of have a constitution would not automatically radically transform the union of state as we know it into the federal superstate which the eurosceptics dread ; it would simply give the people of the Europe under construction a clear idea of the nature of the European Union , thereby allow them to understand it good and identify with it . </s>
( applause ) One of the important question often rightly raise in connection with institutional reform be how the Union will ensure that the small Member States can rest assure that they will not be relegate to a minority by the large Member States , even take due account of the size of the various state . </s>
it seem to me that one possibility might be to create a second chamber in the European Parliament . </s>
it would not , of course , be directly elect ; instead the various parliament would send delegation of perhaps three deputy per state . </s>
the first chamber , I. E. the current parliament , would reflect the size of the various Member States , while the second would reinforce their equality because all Member States would have the same number of deputy . </s>
this would mean that the Commission , for example , would not need to have one member per state and the national parliament could be involve in a much more &quot; hand on &quot; manner . </s>
whatever the process or outcome of institutional reform or the reform which I mention , one thing would appear to be certain : disagreement or the absence of consensus on institutional issue should not hamper the enlargement of the European Union . </s>
be it to do so , too great a delay might have far more dangerous consequence than the failure to complete institutional reform . </s>
lady and Gentlemen , the technical civilisation which cover the entire planet be bear in Europe and have be highly influence by certain aspect of the Euro-American civilisation . </s>
Europe therefore bear a great deal of responsibility for the state of this civilisation . </s>
however , this responsibility should never take the form of forcibly enforce its own value , idea or heritage on the rest of the world . </s>
on the contrary , Europe should , at long last , get its own act together and serve as an example which other may , but be not oblige to , follow . </s>
the whole modern perception of life as continual material progress and growth , base on the assurance of man , who see himself as the master of the universe , be the hidden and regrettable face of the European spiritual tradition . </s>
this perception of life also predetermine the threatening side of our current civilisation . </s>
who , if not this part of the world , should vigorously oppose these threat , give that it be this part of the world which start this trend , send our civilisation into free fall ? </s>
it seem to me that , at this turn point in time , it be up to Europe to take a good look at its equivocal contribution to the world and to realise that we have not only teach the world human right , we have also show it the Holocaust . </s>
we be the spiritual mentor not only for the industrial and then the information revolution , but also when it come to disfigure nature in the name of rampant materialism , pillage its resource and pollute its atmosphere . </s>
we need to understand that , yes , we do open the way to huge development in science and technology ; but we do so at an exorbitant price by do away with a whole set of very important and complex human experience form over several millennium . </s>
Europe need to get its own act together first . </s>
it can make saving , impose hardship , respect - in the well spiritual tradition - the high cosmic order as something which be above and beyond us and respect the moral order as the consequence of that high order . </s>
humility , affability , kindness , respect for what we do not understand , a deep feeling of solidarity with other , respect for what be different , the willingness to make sacrifice or do good deed which eternity alone can reward , the eternity which watch us , silently , through the eye of our conscience . </s>
these be the value which could and should be on the agenda as we construct Europe . </s>
Europe bear all or some of the responsibility for the most horrific event of the 20th century : two world war , fascism and the totalitarian communist regime . </s>
