( it ) Mr President , the approval of this agreement with the Commission on procedure for implement the Council decision on comitology mark the end of a saga which have keep Parliament busy for two year , along with a few enthusiast scatter among the various institution of the Union , whom many people do not hesitate to call masochist . </s>
until @card@ , the way the Commission exercise its executive power , and in particular the mysterious and even suspect committee arrangement , be create conflict and mistrust between the institution , and threaten to have serious consequence on the legislative procedure . </s>
that be why , in accordance with Declaration No @card@ , annex to the Treaty of Amsterdam , the Union institution have undertake a complex task of negotiation and consultation , result in the new Council decision , which revise the old system quite substantially , although we be not entirely satisfy with it . </s>
in particular , the decision outline a form of parliamentary control whereby Parliament can sound the alarm if an implement measure , derive from an act adopt under the codecision procedure , overstep the implement power delegate to the Commission . </s>
during the protracted interinstitutional negotiation - which see Parliament actively involve , thank to the work of the rapporteur , Adelaide Aglietta - it be understand that the European Parliament and Commission would conclude an interinstitutional agreement on the procedure for implement certain aspect of the new decision . </s>
on the one hand , certain point which the Council do not intend to incorporate into the decision be to be make explicit and , on the other , the system for provide information about implement measure and monitor them be to be organise more precisely . </s>
during the trialogue hold on 6 October @card@ in Strasbourg , the president of the European Parliament and the Commission approve the idea of conclude this agreement soon . </s>
we believe we have respect that commitment , and indeed this be make relatively easy by the climate of trust and mutual respect evident throughout the negotiation with the Commission . </s>
essentially , the agreement deal with two point : one be the right of the European Parliament to be inform , which be the sine qua non for the genuine exercise of its right to intervene pursuant to Article 8 of the decision . </s>
hitherto , such information have be supply on paper and unsystematically , and be of no use to our service ; and indeed this be often the fault of Parliament itself . </s>
from now on , the information will be provide by mean of an electronic system call CIRCA , to which the European Parliament will have access . </s>
this represent a real innovation , not only for us , but also - I be sure - for the Commission . </s>
the other point be that Article 8 of the Council decision do not specify either the method by which the European Parliament be to sound the alarm , or the time limit within which it must exercise its restricted power of control . </s>
paragraph 6 and 7 of the agreement confirm that , as a general rule , the European Parliament will adopt its resolution , state its reason , at a plenary sit and have one month to exercise its right of intervention before the Commission adopt the draft implement measure . </s>
but we all realise that it be not always possible to wait a month before implement a measure . </s>
therefore , the agreement contain explicit provision on urgent procedure , include possible action by the committee responsible . </s>
I want to end by stress that we can assess whether this be a good agreement or not , we must wait and see how it work in practice . </s>
the European Parliament need to acquire the resource , which it currently lack , to ensure efficient monitoring of implement measure , and the Commission must accept that some of its practice need reorganising to provide proper information to Parliament and ensure that control can be effective . </s>
finally , it need to be bear in mind that - whatever happen - the real solution to the problem of comitology for the European Parliament be still to change the procedure for implement legislation lay down in the treaty , and gradually to dismantle the committee whose existence represent an anomaly that severely restrict the Commission 's executive power and may prejudice the European Parliament 's legislative power . </s>
Mr President , comitology be a concept most people do not know how to handle and hardly anyone know what it mean . </s>
it make them think of secret society and conspiracy , which be the way thing use to be . </s>
in fact , it imply nothing other than fix the procedure for the exercise of the implement power confer on the Commission . </s>
the procedure for exercise these implement power take the form of a limited number of committee procedure . </s>
up until the Amsterdam Treaty , there be about @card@ variation of these committee procedure , which create neither clarity in the implementation of legislation nor transparency for the citizen . </s>
on the contrary , for a long time even the European Parliament be not inform . </s>
for the European Parliament , the first step in the struggle for more transparency in this jungle of committee be to be inform , at least , of all that the European Commission intend to regulate in the context of these various committee . </s>
agreement be reach in @card@ in the form of an exchange of letter between Lord Plumb and Mr Delors . </s>
a further step towards transparency and the involvement of the European Parliament come with what be know as the modus vivendi of @card@ September @card@ , which grant Parliament the right not only to be inform but also to intervene in certain case . </s>
it also give it the possibility of scrutiny . </s>
with the Amsterdam Treaty , the situation improve decidedly when the number of committee procedure be drastically reduce - as the European Parliament have long want - to three procedure , the administrative procedure , the regulatory procedure and the advisory procedure . </s>
now , follow the Amsterdam Treaty , the right of information and control grant to the European Parliament in the past need to be enshrine anew in an interinstitutional agreement . </s>
Mrs Frassoni , our rapporteur , have do very careful work and identify the question that have to be clarify in the context of that interinstitutional agreement and the administrative procedure that may have to be change within Parliament . </s>
a key problem be the time factor . </s>
when the European Parliament be inform , it generally have to adopt a position within the very short timeframe of four week , should it so wish . </s>
in matter relate to the health and safety of the people of the European Union , the European Commission , as guardian of the treaty and the only institution with the right of initiative , must be in a position to react very rapidly , if necessary within a few hour or day . </s>
nevertheless , the European Parliament must retain the right to be inform and where appropriate also to react . </s>
our rapporteur identify very useful solution to these difficulty , which I and my group can only support in full . </s>

when it come to the IGC , she be one of what the French call &quot; les pures et dures &quot; : no compromise , no deal with the other institution ; we would rather see the whole thing block than compromise our position . </s>

let us remember what be at stake here . </s>
Parliament have four main criticism of the comitology system as it exist prior to the new Council decision supplement by this interinstitutional agreement . </s>
firstly , the whole system be obscure . </s>
it be not transparent with hundred of committee meet with secret agenda and nobody know who be on the committee . </s>
here be a real step forward , in the new system that have be agree . </s>

we be to get the agenda . </s>

the whole system will be more open and transparent - if still rather complex . </s>
so that be at least a step forward . </s>
our second criticism be that the system be very restrictive of the Commission . </s>
we adopt legislation in the European Union . </s>
we expect the Commission to implement it . </s>
and then we have a system design to hinder the Commission and make it more difficult - especially what be call the &quot; contre-filet &quot; system , under which the Council could block the Commission by a simple majority even when the Council be not capable of find an alternative to the implement measure concern . </s>
here too there be at least some progress . </s>
the Council will no longer be able to block implement measure indefinitely beyond the three-month period unless it have a qualified majority to block it , in other word , unless there be substantial opposition among the Member States represent in the Council . </s>
that be a more reasonable system . </s>
that , too , be a step forward . </s>
but on our other two criticism , we be less satisfied . </s>
the first criticism be of the system whereby the Commission be monitor , scrutinise , control if you like , only by a committee appoint by Member States or the Council not by Parliament . </s>
the legislative authority , Council and Parliament , should be equal . </s>
we confer implement power on the Commission , but then it be only a Council or Member State appointed body that can blow the whistle and say no to the Commission and stop the implement measure . </s>
Parliament have no equivalent power . </s>
True , we be now give the beginning of such a power in this new system . </s>
we be to receive all the draft implement measure forward to a committee at the same time as it be send to the committee . </s>
we will have the chance to scrutinise , to debate , to question . </s>
but we will only have the right to formally challenge the Commission if we think it have go beyond the delegation that we have give to the Commission in the legislation . </s>
in other word , we can challenge the measure for be ultra-vires but not on its content . </s>
and in a democracy , Parliament should be able to challenge the content . </s>
not that we do so every week . </s>
we be not seek to immerse ourselves in implement decision , but it be a democratic safeguard that we should be able to do so on those few occasion when it really would be necessary . </s>
that be lack in this new system , or at least be only there in embryonic form . </s>
finally , our fourth criticism be that if an implement measure be block through the comitology system it be refer back , not to both branch of the legislative authority , but to the council alone , which have the right possibly to take an alternative measure . </s>
that be not correct . </s>
both branch adopt the legislation - Council and Parliament - that confer implement power on the Commission . </s>
if such implement measure be refer back , it should be to both branch , not to one branch alone . </s>
overall we have a system which have make some progress . </s>
the supplementary aspect that arise from the interinstitutional agreement with the Commission be welcome , but that could not change the basic decision of the Council . </s>
even here , we have renounce voluntarily - because this do not happen automatically - the Plumb-Delors agreement as part of the overall compromise . </s>
we have be willing to relinquish the provision in that . </s>
we shall have to be very vigilant on what use to be cover by that agreement and be not fully cover by the new decision . </s>
we must be very vigilant . </s>
so it be a step forward . </s>
my group reluctantly accept it as a step forward . </s>
we be not as enthusiastic about compromise as Mrs Frassoni . </s>
we recognise that there be limitation and the issue will no doubt come back in a few year ' time . </s>
if we want a union that be democratic and transparent to the full degree we will have to revisit this subject . </s>

( SV ) Mr President , Commissioner , lady and gentleman , it be my hope that Parliament be prepare now to make a decision to extend and strengthen the financial market in Europe . </s>
as a new Member of the European Parliament , it have be very interesting and instructive for me to be give responsibility for this important matter . </s>
I should especially like to thank my colleague on the committee for their willingness to find compromise ; the President and the Bureau for lend a sensitive ear to this complex issue ; the Commission , and especially the Commissioner , for be such worthwhile contact ; the Council ; and also the division responsible for service the committee , for its selfless work . </s>
There be a good deal of agreement within the committee , apart from on a matter which , too , I hope it will be possible to solve . </s>
the issue of UCITS may appear difficult , technical and a political minefield . </s>
I believe that some people do not even know what UCITS stand for . </s>
allow me , however , to state very clearly that this be a question which really do affect the citizen of Europe in so far as it relate to how their saving be administer , what option there be available , how competition operate between country in regard to different form of saving , saver ' demand for security , and the opportunity Europe 's citizen have to save wisely for their old age . </s>
it be a question of weigh demand for liberalisation in the interest of a good market and high yield against investor ' need for protection and security . </s>
in the course of the 1980s , most market in Europe undergo drastic deregulation . </s>
as a result , the national money and bond market in particular develop very quickly over a period of a few year . </s>
collective investment undertaking become an alternative to save with a bank . </s>
in my own country , more than @card@ per cent of Swede save with a variety of fund . </s>
the security afford by this type of saving be attributable to the broad range of investment vehicle in which the fund be place . </s>
the capital and security market have continue to be develop . </s>
the current directive on UCITS have become antiquated and outdated . </s>
new type of fund have be introduce in the various Member state which be not permit to market their unit in other Member States . </s>
obviously , this inhibit competition and innovation and restrict the public 's range of saving option . </s>
the Commission 's proposal with which we be deal today be in two part . </s>
the first concern the product , that be to say the fund . </s>
the other concern the collective investment undertaking . </s>
the main purpose of the first proposal be to extend the investment opportunity of collective investment undertaking by allow them to invest in unit in other collective investment undertaking , for example unit in fund , standardise option and future contract and deposit in credit institution and in certain type of money market instrument . </s>
special risk-spreading rule be propose in respect of such investment , involve both quantitative and qualitative criterion . </s>
in addition , the Commission 's proposal put forward special risk-spreading rule for fund whose aim be to replicate a particular stock index , a so-called index fund . </s>
the committee wish to make the requirement in relation to the Commission 's proposal more stringent . </s>
To guarantee transparency and prudence , investment in non-harmonised fund should only be allow on condition that qualitative criterion , for example a transparency requirement and investor protection , be introduce . </s>
in addition , quantitative criterion ( risk exposure ) should be introduce . </s>
move on now , then , to the point where there be ( or , I hope , be ) a lack of agreement , namely OTC derivative . </s>
the Commission 's proposal make a distinction between derivative deal in on regulated market and derivative instrument not deal in on regulate market ( so-called OTC derivative ) . </s>
the Commission 's proposal take it as read that OTC derivative be not one of the general type of investment that UCITS deal in , but that they should only be use to achieve efficient portfolio management and to hedge exchange-rate risk . </s>
in recent year , the derivative market have grow very rapidly in almost all the Member States . </s>
it be therefore important that regulation of derivative be flexible so that the market be not tie down ahead of future development . </s>
the definition ' standardise future contract ' and ' standardise option ' should therefore be combine to form a new definition , ' financial derivative instrument ' , which also cover OTC derivative . </s>
investment in OTC derivative , however , should only be allow on condition that both quantitative and qualitative criterion be introduce . </s>
they be very important in this case . </s>
they must be introduce to guarantee the protection of investor . </s>
the Commission 's second proposal focus on the body which manage UCITS , that be to say management company . </s>
the rule for management company , for example the condition for start up and conduct business , be bring into line with the existing rule and regulation . </s>
a crucial point be that rule be propose for so-called simplify prospectus . </s>
relevant information must be give to prospective unit-holder in a fund in a language which be readily understandable to investor in the host country . </s>
in this regard , too , the committee be prepare to go further than the Commission . </s>
a question which have also be discuss in the committee be that of the capital contribution to be require from management company . </s>
There be different view on this . </s>
One of the most important thing , for me , personally , be that the common regulation should not cause small company to go under . </s>
during the month that I have be work on this report , one very clear demand have emerge , both from industry and from those who represent the consumer . </s>
the current situation be not good . </s>
both saver and the industry need modernise regulation for the whole of Europe . </s>
I believe that today 's proposal strike a good balance between liberalisation of the market and the desire for effective protection for investor . </s>
I just want to conclude by say that a number of member of Parliament think that the present proposal go too far , while other think that I be not sufficiently liberal . </s>
To them I just want to say , as the English expression go , ' you can ' t have it all . </s>

Mr President , our objective in set a framework for unit trust and other UCTIS be to secure the high possible safe return for our saver , which be why I want to address the issue of derivative in my remark today . </s>
I firmly believe that the prudent use of derivative can help fund secure , safe , high return . </s>
despite their image of danger , derivative be usually use by asset manager as insurance . </s>
a contract that , for example , pay a substantial sum if , say , the Nasdaq or the CAC @card@ share index fall , cause an extra payment by the investor if the Nasdaq or the CAC @card@ share index rise . </s>
be this speculative ? </s>
not at all . </s>
imagine you have spend some month build up a portfolio of share in company in which you be confident : they have good management , good prospect and they be good investment . </s>
then you become worried that the whole stock market be go to collapse , as it do in @card@ . </s>
you have the option of sell off everything and get into cash , but that would be to waste your research into the winner . </s>
it would also incur all the transaction cost of sell your share and then buy them again after the fall . </s>
the solution be to take out a derivative which pay off if the Nasdaq or CAC @card@ fall . </s>
but even with a tailor-made derivative or OTC derivative which would be cheap , perhaps insure you against a relative fall in your portfolio against the index , you would still have the portfolio and the share , but you would have protect yourself against the risk of a collapse . </s>
in exchange , you might also have give up some of the upside of the market . </s>
in this case , which be perhaps the most common use of derivative by asset manager , you reduce your potential reward but you also reduce your potential risk . </s>
that be a desirable development in a soundly manage fund . </s>
history demonstrate that investor benefit from a liberal and light-handed approach to regulation . </s>
heavy-handedness - a prescription of how private sector manager should invest and where they should invest - will merely reduce return to saver . </s>

this be what we should be concern about here today . </s>

Mr President , lady and gentleman , in letter date 3 August @card@ and 3 December @card@ , the Council call on the European Parliament , pursuant to Article @card@ of the Treaty , to deliver its opinion on a draft convention between the Member States aim at guarantee improve mutual assistance in criminal matter . </s>
it be thus , as you can see , a very important draft , that will effectively serve to provide the Member States of the Union with a more comprehensive and consistent instrument for mutual assistance . </s>
in actual fact , there be still certain difference of opinion within the Council over the type of convention , and over certain provision contain therein . </s>
some of these difference have already be iron out , but other persist . </s>
the spirit of the proposal be nevertheless to equip those responsible for apply the law - primarily the judiciary , but also the citizen concern - with a valid operational instrument to fight crime , which respect fundamental guarantee as regard defence and general principle of human right . </s>
it be for this reason that , despite the many omission in the text , the provision set out therein could - and I say could , Mr President - be accept on condition that they be suitably amend in order to ensure they can be implement by those responsible for apply the law and be acceptable to the citizen . </s>
the Commission have propose various amendment to this end , all of which aim to systematically restructure the Council proposal by suggest a series of technical adjustment that will render the text harmonious and consistent as regard the amendment propose . </s>
the amendment can be summarise as follow : they place great emphasis on fundamental right of defence , introduce a range of technical modification need to make a whole series of obscure and inconsistent passage more comprehensible , and delete the section relate to the remote interception of telecommunication , an area which still require not only increase technical awareness but also acceptance on the part of the government of the various Member States of the Union . </s>
the proposal , as formulate by the Council and subsequently amend by the Commission , provide for a convention base on three title : the first lay down guideline for ensure the consistency of procedure and formality for letter rogatory ; the second list a whole series of specific request for mutual assistance and define the formality and procedure which must be follow in relation to these specific type of mutual assistance ; the third and last provide for and codify the procedure via which telephone conversation conduct by citizen in a State other than the one instigate proceeding can and must be intercept . </s>

Mr President , industrial change , which can be gradual or sudden , be drive by new technology , worldwide competition or consumer preference . </s>
it have economic implication and an impact on employment and social cohesion , but it also provide major new opportunity when anticipate , prepare for and manage . </s>
the acceleration of technological progress and the increase competitive pressure of globalising market be push company to rapidly adapt their production and company structure . </s>
company must be able to anticipate and identify at an early stage what they need to do to ensure the continuity of their activity . </s>
sometimes this call for merger of activity . </s>
the Commission be acutely aware of this situation and of the need for people to feel basic security in difficult time of change . </s>
we be convince that the cornerstone of successful adaptation to change be dialogue at all level and with full and transparent information as its basis . </s>
we have have in the recent past different experience and approach on how to deal with large-scale operation of corporate restructuring , often affect the life of large number of European people . </s>
in some case these operation be prepare well in advance , fully involve worker ' representative , with due care be take to search for the least damaging solution . </s>
where necessary , worker likely to be affect be prepare through employability measure to face the challenge of sudden unemployment . </s>
in other case these operation be launch and implement with less care and concern for those affect . </s>
on every occasion , and as recently as last October in this House , the Commission have highlight the follow basic position . </s>
firstly , decision on corporate restructuring remain the prerogative as well as the responsibility of management . </s>
this mean that , when contemplate action likely to lead to serious social consequence , job loss for example , company should always actively search for and choose the least negative and least damaging solution . </s>
secondly , when dismissal prove to be inevitable , the utmost must be do to reinforce the employability of those concerned . </s>
this require anticipation , timely preparation and careful management of these process . </s>
thirdly , nothing can justify the absence of timely , effective and comprehensive information and consultation of the worker ' and employee ' representative before such operation be launch or publicly announce . </s>
worker involvement be always , and particularly in the event of corporate restructuring , not only a basic right but a necessary precondition for the social acceptance of such operation . </s>
in the end it be also a decisive factor of their success , as no collectivity can survive and prosper without trust , dialogue , partnership and solidarity between its different component . </s>
these basic idea meet with a wide consensus in Europe . </s>
this be what intelligent restructuring be about . </s>
it be more and more rare to see company embark on damaging restructuring operation ignore these fundamental concern , as unfortunately be sometimes the case in the past . </s>
we have build a wide range of instrument which meet these concern in recent year in the European Union . </s>
we have set minimum requirement at European level , which all Member States and all company must observe when contemplate job loss , especially when they be massive , or prepare other decision likely to affect worker . </s>
the collective redundancy and transfer of undertaking directive and the European work council directive constitute our legal framework , protect the worker ' right and ensure fair standard in the field of information and consultation at national and transnational level respectively . </s>
as regard the national and / or local level of employee involvement , the Commission wish to underline again the need for proper information and consultation of employee ' representative before any redundancy be decide or implement , as provide for in the collective redundancy directive and in other national provision . </s>
I wish to recall that it be , in principle , up to national court to deal with possible violation of these rule , if and when they be bring before them by national representative . </s>
however , even when existing rule or arrangement be formally respect this do not mean that management 's attitude be socially irreprehensible . </s>
in fact , the Commission have argue for some time now that the rule we have establish be not sufficient to deal with the challenge of today . </s>
in a world characterise by permanent change and in the context of high level of unemployment , the rule in force seem to us to be outdate as they do not allow or promote the key idea behind our employment strategy and our approach to change , anticipation , risk prevention and employability . </s>
that be why in November @card@ the Commission present a proposal for a directive on worker information and consultation which have since then receive your strong support . </s>
we thank you for that . </s>
unfortunately , the other branch of the legislative power , the Council , have not yet - more than one year after the presentation of the proposal - begin work on it . </s>
I hope that this debate contribute to remind Member States of the importance and urgent nature of this initiative . </s>
we have recently hear from the Portuguese Presidency that a serious debate on this proposal will soon be launch . </s>
the forthcoming French Presidency also seem willing to give this dossier the high priority it deserve . </s>
the Commission sincerely hope that Parliament and the Council quickly finalise this important dossier which constitute , in our view , the most effective answer to the concern raise by case such as the one which bring us here today . </s>
as for the transnational level of employee involvement there be some indication that at least in one case the company may have breach transnational information and consultation agreement which they have conclude with their European workforce . </s>
they may have at least exploit some ambiguity in the legal and contractual framework in force . </s>
the Commission will contact the relevant national authority to check this . </s>
in any case , I wish to say to those who believe that their right in that respect be ignore that adequate mean of enforcement and redress be available to them , notably through relevant national jurisdictional instance . </s>
the Commission be aware of your request to proceed immediately with a revision of the European Works Council Directive . </s>
as recognise in the report , which we will adopt in the forthcoming week , we accept that the directive contain some loophole . </s>
nevertheless , as my colleague , Commissioner Diamantopoulou have already underline on other occasion , when decide whether or not to revise the directive immediately , different consideration must be take into account . </s>
first , any revision of the directive would have little immediate effect on exist agreement , unless the fundamental principle of respect the autonomy of the negotiate party no longer apply . </s>
secondly , an immediate revision would make thing much more complicate as regard progress in respect of the other pend dossier in this field like European company statute and the national information and consultation proposal . </s>
the successful outcome of these other dossier could greatly facilitate the subsequent revision of the EWC Directive and even provide some degree of a solution to the problem identify above . </s>
that be why we tend to consider that it might be more appropriate in this context to proceed with the revision of the European Works Council Directive only after the conclusion of those two dossier and follow a more complete evaluation of the application of the directive . </s>
action be not limit to legislation . </s>
To encourage and support dialogue as the cornerstone of the successful adaptation to change the Commission be also develop the recommendation of the Lillehammer Report by prepare the set up of a European observatory on industrial change . </s>
we be also develop another suggestion of that expert group , the Managing Change Report . </s>
let me finish by address some of the other concern express in the draft resolution submit to this House . </s>
as for the enforcement of the link between competition policy and social policy , let me remind you that there be a provision in the merger regulation which enable worker ' representative to be hear by the Commission in the framework of the relevant procedure . </s>
generally speak , we recognise the need for proper consideration to be give in different instance to all aspect surround these kind of operation , include their effect in term of employment . </s>
as an example of this I mention that public authority , notably the Commission , have already take measure through guideline on national regional aid that come into force on 1 January this year so as to ensure that public funding remain associate with the recipient of regional aid and consequently with the job attach to the investment . </s>
To this end all regional aid be make conditional on the maintenance of the investment in question for a minimum period of five year . </s>
the same provision be include in the Structural Funds Regulation which mean that it apply to all investment cofinanced by the structural fund . </s>
social cohesion and the interplay of policy at EU-level be the focus of the forthcoming Lisbon Summit . </s>
I know we will be come back to these issue again in the future to see how we can well make sure our policy be adapt and reform to underpin economic and social progress in Europe . </s>
thank you very much Commissioner . </s>

tourism and employment the next item be the report ( A5 ­ @card@ / @card@ ) by Mr Viceconte , on behalf of the Committee on Regional Policy , Transport and Tourism , on the communication from the Commission : ' Enhancing tourism 's potential for employment - follow-up to the conclusion and recommendation of the High Level Group on Tourism and Employment ' [ COM ( @card@ ) @card@ - C5-0112 / @card@ - @card@ / @card@ ( Cos ) ] . </s>
, rapporteur . </s>
( it ) Mr President , lady and gentleman , despite the European Union 's delay and indecision with regard to the introduction of a fully-fledged Community policy on tourism , increase attention be be pay to tourism as a sector capable of generate new job . </s>
One of the reason for the Community 's interest be the structural flexibility of this sector of the employment market , which explain its attractiveness for woman and young people , to whom it often offer their first experience of employment . </s>
the importance of the tourist industry and its impact on employment - although everyone be now aware of this - be nevertheless base more on personal experience rather than on verifiable statistical datum . </s>
the fact that , due to the absence of sufficiently reliable and scientific statistical datum , the tourist industry be in effect an unknown quantity have greatly limit the prospect of pursue a consistent policy in this area and create employment on a wide scale . </s>
it would be appropriate , therefore , to begin by summarise the impact of tourism on the life of Union citizen and the desirability , in both economic and social term , of promote the European tourist industry . </s>
firstly , I would remind you that the tourist industry be one of the infrastructure which any advanced society must have . </s>
without it , institution , business and the world of work could not function . </s>
Tourism must therefore be think of as the whole range of good and service require by individual move from their habitual place of residence and thus confer mobility , the characteristic feature of contemporary society . </s>
the term ' tourism ' must no longer be solely perceive as synonymous with sun , sea and holiday , which have the effect of reduce the interest take in the subject at institutional level . </s>
secondly , I would like to explode a myth , take as a start point an apparent paradox , which be clearly highlight by Eurostat figure : the main international tourist country be not those traditionally regard as tourist destination , but on the contrary the most advanced nation , whose quality of life be one of their main attraction and most heavily promote feature . </s>
clearly , the importance of tourism for the economy of region traditionally regard as tourist destination , southern region for example , be very different , and should be study carefully . </s>
it be an obvious truth , and one that be measurable by other economic and social indicator , that thank to tourism , many Mediterranean region have undergo a radical change for the good in their economic and social system and the way of life of their inhabitant , and achieve a drastic reduction in the number emigrate . </s>
social growth have occur only in those area where the tourist market have give rise to the development of all the activity require to meet the need of visit tourist , thus create an entire productive system . </s>
in such case , there be a measurable increase in employment as a result of the growth in tourist number , thus establish a virtuous circle of growth in the local economy . </s>
this remind us that tourism can be regard as the poor country ' petroleum industry , because it require huge investment in structure , infrastructure , entrepreneurship , professional expertise , social service and training ; that the tourist industry be essential for the equilibrium of many region as it provide a direct source of employment and a market for all local productive activity : agriculture , small firm in the industrial and craft sector , transport , service , retail sector , training , etc ; that the development of the Community 's tourist industry be closely link to its sustainability with regard to the Community objective ; that the varied geography and historical , cultural and environmental heritage must be protect and exploit . </s>
in my opinion , the European Union can , in compliance with the principle of subsidiarity , supplement the action of the Member States and contribute to consolidate the potential of tourism by mean of certain measure , such as the adoption of a specific legal basis for tourism policy in the treaty ; the adoption of mechanism within the programme and project set up under its regional policy and other policy of the Union , with a view to promote tourism in all its form : rural , environmental , cultural , conference-based , spa-related and sports-related tourism , and also tourism focus on senior citizen , research and training ; the amendment of Directive @card@ / @card@ / EC on the collection of statistical information in the field of tourism ; the cofinancing of project to set up new transport service and infrastructure ; the cofinancing of pilot scheme involve benchmarking and the exchange of experience . </s>
these and other specific measure include in my report can , in my view , lend add value to the action that the competent national and regional authority should foster , in order to promote tourism and create new job , start with the adoption of positive fiscal measure to assist small and medium-sized firm , particularly by reduce the burden of charge on labour . </s>
